Summary Heading: Good Value Hotel Near Cal State Fullerton
Summary: As stated in the title, this is a good value hotel near Cal State Fullerton. Also Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, etc, are all close by. The front desk employees are all really nice. The rooms are okay,  no "wow" factor. A couple of minor complaints, wash cloths were not in our bathroom, had to ask the front desk for some. 2 out of 3 soap/shampoo dispensers were empty. For the breakfast, it is always nice when a hotel offers this, but avoid the scrambled eggs and potatoes, they are disgusting. Eat cereal, muffins, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit, etc. For the hotel, if they are reading this, make fresh scrambled eggs and potatoes, this goes a long way.

I had an enjoyable stay.  The room, facility and surrounding area were all clean and well maintained.  It is obvious that management and staff are committed to providing a safe and excellent hotel experience.  Management and staff were courteous and professional.

I loved my stay at best western plus because not only is it very comfortable but the team are so kind and courteous  they make you feel great it's cause of them I keep returning. I love the breakfast there and the atmosphere there is wonderful.

Summary Heading: Christine the manager is a racist
Summary: Christine l was the worst representative I’ve ever encountered when staying at a best western. I’d advise staying anywhere else! Traveling with my son who is 11 and experiencing this with him to witness was nothing short of horrific.

Sat in the lobby for two hours waiting for a room while watching a representative play on their phone the entire time. What a waste. I was heavily dissatisfied with the room cleanliness but am not overly surprised after seeing the location in person. Again, the level of customer service will have you regretting you chose best western.

I can not recommend this location enough! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and definitely made our stay enjoyable. The entire hotel was extremely clean and had great amenities. We had an issue with room assignments when our second group arrived but the staff went above and beyond to make sure we had conjoined rooms and all the amenities we needed!!

We had booked another location but changed when we saw the reviews of other place. This hotel was sooo clean, smelled clean, staff so helpful!  Location was very good!  Security was good. Didn’t worry bout car or surroundings

The room was big, it was clean, they added their touch by decorating restroom. We did not have to walk far to get to our car. Pool was available, breakfast was simple to order and we got it pretty quickly. Definitely enjoyed our stay.

I was a breath of fresh air checking into this hotel after having a bad experience at the hotel I originally had reservations for. I will definitely be booking here again whenever I have to travel to Anaheim in the future.

Summary Heading: Conveniently located, clean, and friendly staff!
Summary: I had booked another Anaheim/Yorba Linda area hotel at about the same price, but after comparing reviews, I saw the error of my ways and canceled the other booking. I'm so glad I did, because this hotel stay exceeded my expectations. I'm a BW Rewards member, and the rate was lower than what I saw on Google and other reservation sites. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the room was clean and quiet. The breakfast food wasn't fancy, but it was included and served with a smile. I'll be back!

We stayed here one night so we could go to Disneyland. We stayed a little further away but parking was free and the Uber ride to Disneyland was cheap. It couldn’t of worked out better! Every staff member we encountered was amazing and went above and beyond to make her one little night super! The proximity to Disneyland was also great but just out of the Disney bubble so you pay normal prices for everything. The room was exceptionally clean and you can’t beat the shower pressure and hot water! It was amazing! We would stay here again and again and again !

Clean and safe place to stay reasonable priced.  Management and staff were courteous and professional. Close to shopping and restaurants. Everything in the room worked well:  WiFi, TV, Mini Refrigerator, and Microwave.

Good for family overall, good for money. The heater had some issue, the internet had some issue. They fix the internet twice. They offer free coffee and tea onsite. The check-in time is too late. It should start from 2 PM.

I love staying at the BW Plus Anaheim hotel on Orangethrope.  I feel safe and comfortable.  This hotel is just one offramp from my grandkids home so very convenient for me.  Plenty of free parking. Coffee ready in the lobby early and then breakfast if I need it (if I am not taking the kids out for breakfast).  Usually only stay one or two nights, but I recommend this hotel.

My wife was having neck surgery and the staff here were so awesome. Always cheerful and concerned about our needs. We were given a first floor room with handicap rails which helped with my wife’s  recovery a lot.

This place is amazing and I will highly recommend it to anyone. Very clean and peaceful. Great selection on movie channels. Respectful and highly trained personnel. The gym and the laundry facility are great to have around. Dennis restaurant right next-door. It was a great day thank you all for a great job.

We checked-in in the middle of the night and it was a breeze. Helpful and courteous staff. Clean room and quiet morning staff. Love it!!! This one might replace another of our favorite hotel in the area.

The staff there was terrible the young lady at the front desk cut me off while I was speaking to my husband to get the bathroom key from me yes you have to get a key from the front desk for the key and then they would not rent me another because I over payed for a wheelchair accessible room and was in basic room ju st to control my stay how ridiculous I want my money back and then the breakfast was horrible

I approach the front desk, I Just want to extend to three more day when I give her the room number, she immediate say you are late for you check out. I say to her that my wife asks for a late check out and was granted to her, I say look on your computer it should at list have a note, she says a don’t see anything. I say is ok, I want to extend. From this point on. I cannot say it has exceeded my expectation. On the contrary it was under the expectations. She was unprofessional, she did not accept a recommendation.  I was treated as racist because I am Latino and the front desk personal could no accept me as equal, and she is a Latina too.

Only hotel that I stay in when visiting Orange County. It is off the beaten path a bit but well worth the detour. Near many good restaurants and attractions. Always immaculate and welcoming. Hard to find a good, reasonable hotel experience these days!

Very close to Disneyland, making it a great place to stay for your trip. Area is nice and the hotel presents as high-end, put together, and clean making for a great competitor. Front desk staff was very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. More of a "fuller" breakfast with Covid precautions still taken, which was great to see and have again. Breakfast staff was fun, welcoming, and helpful as well :) Very impressed with this BW location and employees! The bedroom decor and bedspread is a bit outdated however the rest of the hotel, location, and services seems to make up for it!

We have stayed here once before a year ago and were very happy with the accommodations. So we booked again this time a week ahead and were looking forward to our stay. We reserved 2 queen standard. The day before we were going I decided to call to see about an upgrade to the deluxe 2 king bed room. I was told that they didn’t offer that type of room there, even though I was looking at the room on the web site at the same time on the phone with a lady at their front desk. I accepted her answer knowing I’d ask when we got there. We arrived and while checking in we asked about their deluxe double king bed room, we were informed that they had 2 left so we decided to pay the extra to upgrade. When we got in the room it seemed very clean. My husband went to park the car and run to the

The inside was very clean, beds were comfy, breakfast included is a plus. If you choose to experience the transit like we did the bus routes aren't too bad to get to places. Has good amenity options, but there will be no microwave at all to use.  Overall was a pleasant stay for us.

Breakfast was great and welcoming, nice staff. The pool is small, gym is nice (no dumbbells, bikes, BoFlex machine, laundry machine too in it). I am a BW rewards member great perks. Great experience all around. Honestly, better than other BW’s I stayed at. Room was very nice and solid, very private. Great hotel appearance inside and outside. Very helpful nice welcoming staff. High rated hotel and well worth it. Recommend. Thank you.

I don’t normally leave reviews but I had such an awful experience with BestWestern that I want to warn potential future customers of this hotel.   I am extremely disappointed in the customer service provided by this hotel! I had booked two rooms for my family and I, and gotten an adjoining room with two beds in each. After arriving at 1 am, we had called front desk to request towels (which came up after we called twice) and an extra comforter which was never sent up. As a result, we were left no choice but to move one of the comforters from one room into the other for extra comfort, and we’d forgotten to replace it back in the room we’d originally gotten it from before checking out. Despite both rooms being under my name, being beside one another (and connected through a door),

Sadly this is a great hotel with very poor communication and even worse management. Christina the AM Manager is absolutely horrid! Very seldom do I write bad reviews let alone speak upon someone directly but she is a horrible hotel manager. Never have I ever been "banned" from a hotel... anywhere! If Christina decides she doesn't like you solely based upon appearance she'kk cancel your reservation and won't notify until very last minute. She's unprofessional, argumentative, and has zero hospitality skills. The facilities are well kept. No guest after 10pm and no more than 2 ppl per room or you have to pay extra. The breakfast was pretty decent compared with most hotels.

Came all the way from Oregon with reservations in hand printed out from the hotel email with rates and dates. Tried to check in and they refused to look at what they had sent me and only at the computer. Told me i was supposed to check in 2 days ago and that i was charged as a no show (their mistake) so again I show them the letter again they don't look or care. So the manager comes out and says she will refund and try to get a room at the going rate. Very Rude. Said rooms are now more that they already comfirmed then when i asked why i should have to pay more she got even ruder and handed me a phone number to call customer service since she had none. Bottom line hotel told customer service agent they would refund but no rooms were available even though they offered one 2

Their employees were so welcoming and respectful!! I really felt welcomed and enjoyed my stay! Thank You! I would not change anything! I wish i could of used the gym since it was open but forgot to take proper clothing!

I visited the Placentia location and experienced poor service I believe was due to my race as my family were the only black people.  Myself, my 13 year old son and 7 year old daughter stayed one night but was charged a mysterious smoking fee they refused to remove.

Our original plan to spend three nights stretched to eight as we tried to help a 96 year old relative move into assisted living.  This BW Plus made our stay very comfortable, as we were exhausted every night!  Hot breakfast was appreciated and made a good start to our busy day, and Covid precautions were in place and appreciated.

Summary Heading: Unprofessional & Accusing Management and Staff!! Horrifying Hotel!!
Summary: We have been loyal guest for some time now. Upon our first encounter they had a Trainee by himselft (Giovanni) and he was so unsure how to check us in. Than first nite we had a water leakage w/cockroaches in the room we had Gemen the security guard verified the area. Per German we needed to check w/ front desk to find out if we had to change rooms. Upon arriving in for the evening Daniel also trainee stated management went into our room while we were gone without permission. Than we were upset and he said "oh no" I ordered maintenance to go in we were so upset without giving anyone the consent to do so. Daniel than said "can I be real with both of you? We said "please do"! Daniel stated he lied about going into our room and said he did not know why he lied. We were so upset at

Summary Heading: Best place to stay when in Orange County
Summary: I always try to stay at this hotel when in the area. Convenient, clean, and friendly. What more can anyone ask for?? Only complaint is why does this review need to be 200 characters?? Restaurants are close by.

exceptional place to stay! the entire staff is great! their cleaning is exceptional and prefer to stay here when I am in the area. top notch place to stay! under the current situation and what other hotels are offering their breakfast is far above what the other hotel chains are doing right now!

I’m a Select Diamond Member & staying @ this FANTASTIC property!!  Marisol on check-in is SO Pleasant & helpful! The rooms @ this Best Western Plus are exceptionally clean & disinfected.  Breakfast was a hot offering with VERY cleaned seating.  Juliana.... I think I just misspelled her name🙃... was SO VERY Kind serving our Breakfast.  This is a MUST Centrally located to ALL the OC has to offer.

Tucked away from the Main Street and quiet. The staff were very professional. We especially loved how clean EVERYTHING was. Loved the option of a 2 KING beds. Appreciated the floors not having carpets. The shower did have a couple mold spots but because I always bring bleach when we travel I took care of it. The breakfast was great and we were so happy that they still provided breakfast, I think there should have been an extra person helping the one serving the breakfast because the other guest were complaining. Other wise we absolutely love this place. Keep up the great work, hopefully next time the pool will be open.

My wife and I stayed here on Thursday September 17, 2020. I checked out on Tuesday 22 and I did not have a good experience. We stayed on room 332 on the 3rd floor. Our first night while my wife was in the bathroom drying her hands, she saw a lizard on the floor. We assume it was on the towels but my wife was really scared. We were shocked since we had never had a problem in any hotel and this one that is supposedly "highly recommended" offered us this horrendous experience. After a few seconds when the panic went down, we caught the lizard with a towel and put it in a bag. We decided to take it to the front desk to let them know what happened and even worse was the experience with the receptionist. Without even apologizing, he just made a rude comment asking if we were afraid of

Slowly getting back out from the pandemic. Spent the day away from home. Property was rearrange to facilitate new guideline. Felt very safe, in the room and around the hotel. Staff was well equipped and made us feel comfortable.

I booked this hotel for the price. It was nicer than hotels I’ve paid twice for. Friendly staff. Fast service. Best hot breakfast. Spotless rooms. Gorgeous lobby. If you have a car, take advantage of their free parking and drive to Disneyland instead of staying at a closer not so nice hotel. I will be coming back. It is my new go to hotel for any visit to Anaheim.

very clean, fresh and you feel secured.  The staff are very courteous, polite and helpful. The breakfast is being served very quickly.  The room is always cleaned up and is always ready for use.  With good internet access.

I enjoyed my stay .. during the covid..  no pool.. but breakfast was offered..  they staff tried their best to make it comfortable and nice for the guests..  overall a good place to stay .. dennys right next door very convienient.

Amazingly clean hotel maybe because it's newly opened, very close t Denny's restaurant. Quiet place to stay, great breakfast and hugely size rooms. Good value of money to stay. Close to amusement parks like Disneyland, Knots-berry Farm and some outlet malls.

Hello, My husband and I recently spent 5 nights here when California was going into lock down. As surreal as it was we felt secure and at home during our stay. We did have an issue and Ron from maintenance came a immediately fixed it. We got talking and mentioned that we were heading back to Australia the next day and asked him where we could get face masks from as we had been unsuccessful, within 5 minutes he came back with 2 masks for us. I cannot tell you how appreciative we were of Ron doing this for us. You would be 'hard pressed' to find any faults with a Best Western hotel. Outstanding service right there.

this hotel requires a face lift , my second time staying   and wont be a 3rd. will stay at the PLUS one a few miles away. last year i was told they were doing a face lift , not so. BW is a good chain , suggest stay at a plus

The room was clean and comfortable we had a family room with bunk beds ... It was great !!! My kids enjoyed the pool we usually swim the day of check in 🏊. It's close to the parking lot to walk over and jump on the tram if you don't want to walk to the park not too far .. I prefer the tram. Breakfast was good better than others I've had in near by hotels.

This hotel offers clean well equipped room, friendly service and peace of mind on reasonable price. We found only one major point for improvement- the breakfast and the scrambled eggs in particular. Avoid them as they are horribly made. Instead focus on the done by you waffles.

This location is near Brea, Anaheim, Cal State Fullerton, Southern LA County, which comes in handy if you hate wasting time on Freeways, and the staff is Always welcoming.  I try to use this location in lieu of many choices, when I can.

We are super happy with this hotel, we have stayed here before, we have family in Fullerton, and we will definitely be back, the staff are excellent, super nice , helpful and efficient. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and in a very low traffic convenient area.

I stay at this property every trip to So Cal for business. The hotel is located close to my corporate office and a number of good resturants, the rooms are comfortable, clean, quiet, the staff are friendly and efficent. 95% of my stays I get the room and floor location I request when booking my stay. I am always offered upgraded room when available.  Probably whay I always look at this property first when travelling to So Cal.

The hotel is very nice and the staff is exceptionally attentive, kind and courteous. Karen is an valuable asset to the staff. She was so accommodating during our stay. The location is close to all of north Orange Country. Very quiet location.

Clean and close to freeway.  Easy access to restaurants and shopping.  Hot tub and pool clean.  Breakfast staff exceptional.  Quiet room on 3rd floor.  Lots of parking, well lit.  Good value for area that's close to entertainment.

If your looking for a quality place to stay here it is ! The customer service is always excellent, kind and considerate to your needs as a guest. I have been coming here for 3 years and my experience is always so pleasant!

Stayed here 2 nights for a Disneyland trip! It was great! It was fairly close, less than a 15 minute drive. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean and quiet. The bed was comfortable. The room was well equipped with toiletries. The waffles were perfect. I will stay here again

I really want to give a huge compliment to front desk Celene and housekeeping Isabel!! They went over and beyond for me. Yesterday I had my 3 year old daughter in the tub and I had a medical emergency when my blood sugar dropped really low. I called down to Celene and notified her of my condition and asked for some orange juice and she had Isabel come to my room with a glass of orange juice within minutes and then they brought up a pitcher of juice just in case I needed more. Isabel stayed with me to make sure I was good. Every time I have stayed here the staff is wonderful! Hotel is clean and I had a minor issue the first night and it was taken care of right away! The only real complaint is the beds are a little stiffer than I prefer but a wonderful place to stay! Thank you

This hotel appears to be newly renovated and everything was nearly perfect from the decor to the service to the excellent hot breakfast. My only complaint is that there were no outlets on the nightstand or lamp. I had to unplug the clock to plug in my phone.

This was the best hotel we stayed in during our stay in the US. The place is clean and much better than the average motel. The Girls at front desk were really helpful and got us out of a incorrect booking at another best Western buy our travel agent

This hotel understands the value of cleanliness. They are actually better than the 5 star hotel that I stayed before. I like the overall appearance of the hotel, their cleanliness and their cappuccino is excellent!

Staff was great very friendly.  Room was clean.  Bed was a little firm for me.  Easy on and off the freeway.  Denny’s on site was nice if you didn’t want to drive to get food.  If you arrive back to hotel after midnight you have to use room key to enter.  Like this as an added safety measure.

Staff from check in desk to housekeeping to breakfast room had and excellent service oriented attitude which was much appreciated. Most Best Western Hotels we stay at were generally a good value for the money but this hotel stood out because of the attentive attitude of ALL the staff we encountered during our stay.

What a super surprise I had at Best Western....clean, professional, comfortable and very affordable ....a great experience  Spacious room that was extremely clean....bed was comfortable and the property was hidden away from traffic, noise and transient people.

Had a great experience.  The room was nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  Enjoyed the breakfast.  Also got for a great price.  Went to Disneyland and it is a short drive and worth it at the price.

Need it to stay at a hotel that was near Disneyland there were many other hotels nearby at the value is very reasonable at this one it had breakfast in the morning a full breakfast and wasn't too far away from the park which was 6 miles but direct shot to the park customer service was outstanding they had tended to all our needs and made our experience very joyful you will be staying at this hotel again in the future when we come back to deal to land with our grand kids and our children.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and it is safe
Summary: The front desk is excellent.  Breakfast is good.  Internet is good.  The only negative is after I checked in, I found out the service personnel did not wipe all the surfaces of tables, nightstand, etc., so I had to use towels to cover them. The sticky round ring from a drink of the previous guest was present.  This turned me off right away so watch out.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel accommodations for business trip.
Summary: Very good hotel in convenient location.  Easy in and out, ample parking.  Clean and comfortable rooms.  Breakfast selection was very good, and the quality of the food was excellent.  My favorite was the Spanish sauce for the omelette.  I would have liked a better pillow selection. I ended up not using a pillow as those provided were foam-filled and pushed my head up too high, causing a stiff neck!  Otherwise, the bed and room were ideal. Convenient to freeways, but far enough away not to have freeway noise.  Staff was excellent; attentive and professional.  A good find.

As always, Best Western offers a good value and more than you expect. There's nothing noteworthy, just a clean room, comfortable bed and quality amenities.  Our only complaint is the breakfast. This is our second time here and both times, none of the hot food was hot. There is a basic assortment of bacon and eggs and waffles you make fresh. Nothing too exciting and it would be fine if it was at least warm.

Staying here quite often... nice gem of a place recently remodeled decor is nice. great stay noticed that many business travelers stay here... only thing to need to upgrade the breakfast bar maybe extend the and hrs offering better hot food

The stay at Best Western Plus was terrible. They charge you to check in early. $25 an hour to check in early. But my main problem was the beds. The mattresses for so hard all we did was toss and turn. My son my fiance and I woke-up with back aches.  it's like the mattresses are filled with cement I've never stayed in a hotel for the match there so hard. Needless to say we didn't get any rest all night so we were happy to get out of that hotel glad we only stayed one night.  when I reported to the front desk the lady only refunded me for my early check-in fee really didn't care about the lack of sleep that we received. Will not be staying here again they charge too much for their quality of room that they give

Location was newly renovated.Front receptionist Jessica was a great help, extremely nice and made check in a great experience. Breakfast lounge had a great variety of food to choose from and staff was very helpful especially Alicia she cleaned up tables promptly and went out of her way to make my families waffles...Thanks again will be returning soon.

I spent one night at this hotel and was not sure about the location, safety and quality.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  Great location (2 blocks from freeway), good breakfast, fabulous staff and good room.  It appears that this hotel has been recently renovated.  I ride a motorcycle and am always concerned about where I park overnight.  This hotel is set back a bit from the street behind a restaurant and seems very secure.  I did park near the lobby, for piece of mind.  But I think most anywhere would be fine.   I would definitely return to this hotel.

Christina Lopez is a terrible manager. During our very lengthy stay, the pool was never in fact open. The breakfast is horrible and cheap. She is condescending and a bad manager in general. Despite many attempts to have her re trained at the least, she remains a manager as a direct result of negligence in the owner Sandy and the Best Western chain. I do not recommend spending one penny here.

I paid pennies for the best hotel in the Orange County Area.  I see this place is rated 2 stars and I'm wondering why?  My room was amazing, large, and very clean.  I really enjoyed this hotel room and the staff was excellent to top it off.  My interaction checking in was excellent.  Bed was excellent!

I've stayed here several times and love this place.  Great staff with comfortable rooms.  Always enjoy the breakfast here! Great location and has a Denny's that is in the same lot so it's convenient for meals.

The beds are the perfect height... they are comfy as well. We were just looking to get a room for ourselves for a night so we could have some adult alone time, and this worked out great. Price and convenience were right on point. Windows in the room open which is nice, and the coffee machine in the lobby is a definite plus.

BW + Anaheim Orange County Hotel - immaculately clean - spacious comfortable room nice breakfast with very friendly and customer centric staff- really - I thought I was in a 5 Star Hotel - this Hotel is 10 plus Star - couldn't believe the price!!

Stayed for two days visiting friends.  Location is great, tucked away on a busy boulevard and Denny's right there in parking lot.  Hotel is very clean, rooms great with a side living space and nice desk area for work.  Will definitely stay there again.

The hotel was beautiful, room was GREAT, staff was wonderful. Breakfast was good. Lots to choose from. 10 mins from Disneyland and right next door to Denny's. Bed and pillows were so comfortable. No outdoor noise. Shower was good too. We'll definitely stay here again

Above and beyond my expectations. Staff was  professional and courteous. Very well located for Disneyland a bit far though fro travel to Universal City Hollywood,This property is really a five star hotel in disguise.Parking is free and has a enjoyable outdoor seating area to use day or night. Feel very secure and safe in this property.

Hi,  I  can guarantee I will not be staying at this Best Western  hotel property again.     Celine, the front dest clerk has to be the rudest hotel reception clerk I have ever experienced.   She definitely needs lessons in diplomacy and customer service!  Beware, when you check in you need the Make, Model, color and license number of your vehicle.    I told Celene I knew all but the license number.   She told me I had to go get it now!    I told her I did not want to walk all the way back to the car with my bags all here and everything.   So she very rudely told me she would not check me in without and stood there and stared at me to show me it was her way or the highway!  Celene, it is not always what you ask but how you ask it!!!!  Not your best choice!  Jim

Around $100 a night  this is a new or updated hotel with ample parking, near major road for access to Orange County.  Our room was near the back and quiet with the exception of noisy kids in an adjoining room (may want to avoid these rooms).  Check in, and desk clerks were efficient and friendly.  The lobby very nice with a spiral staircase up to the second floor.  Something you don’t normally see in moderately price hotels.  The suite was spacious with fridge, microwave, large work area, dresser, closet, and sitting bench.  The tv was also large and the bathrooms up to date and green (soap and lotion dispensers versus individual sized).  There was an excellent breakfast with both sausage and bacon.  Would certainly consider this place when in the area again.

it was a great experience for me. The staff was nice and it was right off the freeway. When im in Anaheim for any reason and i need a place to stay, i will definitely choose best  western plus for my stay.

Summary Heading: Second stay just as good as the first!
Summary: Great hotel with amazing service! I always feel welcomed when I come to this hotel. Whenever I need something, all I have to do is ask. It is a very quiet property and there is a restaurant and convenience store within walking distance which also makes it a prime location to stay in!

I stay at this property 3-4 times/year and it's never disappointed.  The beds are very comfortable.  The breakfast is good.  The landscaping is nice even if the surrounding houses are a little run down.  The toiletry amenities are big bottles attached to the wall (very green and eco-focused which I like) however I've started bringing my own bar of soap when I stay for more than 2 nights.  Sometimes the air freshener is very strong and I find that my belongings smell like the hotel when I get home.  For this reason, I don't always opt for housekeeping during my stay.  The breakfast staff are always so friendly!

Stayed at this BW  1 night after returning from 2 weeks in   Mexico. Rested up before making the drive back home to Fresno County. We were  not told when making our reservstion, that the hotel was in remodeling phase! Good breakfadt, comfy bed and clean room. Still good !

Not much of a view but the room is good. Comfortable bed that doesn't squeak every time I breathe, clean room. In the hall I can hear very loud TV's,  but so far I don't hear it in my room. The hotel is located behind Dennys, so you are actually pulling into the Denny's parking lot to get to the hotel. Great location next to the freeway and just 15 mins to Disneyland. Price is great for the location. Just keep in mind all over the area has bad traffic during rush hour (s)

Summary Heading: Beautifully landscaped, so drive up is inviting--inside sparkling clean & comfy beds
Summary: We were here only one night Dec 19th & it was a pleasure to see such a well kept hotel. Being very hard for me to walk & get up & down, they provided a Handicap room on the 1st floor, which made it nice. Bed was comfortable as most all Beds in the Best Western's are.  The desk help was friendly & helpful, giving us ideas of where to get a good meal. Though being tired we chose Denny's right next door for dinner & had the BW on the go breakfast. Would highly recommend it.

We came here on our trip to Disney. It is far from Disney so I would suggest a different hotel. This hotel was under construction. The room was big. We just stayed the night but the room was comfortable. Bathroom was large. Service was great at the front desk.

Summary Heading: In the middle of an upgrade
Summary: Pros: new laminate floors, a built in desk, tiled bathroom walls, comfortable beds, hot breakfast, quiet location. Cons: no lighting besides ceiling lights, no pictures on the wall making the rooms very echoey, shower tile floor stained/not upgraded, rooms need more furniture to put your stuff on instead of the floor.

Summary Heading: Nice place BUT I did NOT feel safe there
Summary: It's a nice hotel, breakfast is good and the staff are friendly and helpful.  Tip: they will fill your water container with filtered water if you ask.  Tip: they have trays so you can bring breakfast back to your room easily.  Issue: the emergency exit doors that need to be kept closed to prevent the spread of fire (if it ever happens) are PROPPED OPEN and thus unsafe and in violation of fire regulations.  Pictures show what I mean.  When I closed the doors, I found them open later and it was the building guard following me around and propping them open again. I spoke to hotel manager, she said that this was "temporary because of the construction and painting going on" but during our 4-day stay there was no construction and no painting going on.

Summary Heading: Only did a quick stop, would stay for more.
Summary: The lobby was torn apart when we got there and I immediately thought "Oh boy..." but I was pleasantly surprised.  Our room was nice, clean, and comfy. The staff was incredibly friendly. The breakfast was great quality for a motel. If we hadn't already had a location right across from Disneyland reserved, I wouldn't have minded staying here and just driving to the parks every day. I was never notified they would be charging my card. When I asked for proof, I called them after I seen the charge. they said they didnt have any. I was so upset. The room was dirty and smelling bad. But I just delt with it all to be charged a extra 50? We will never stay here again.

Awesome money saver. Definately going to be staying here again. if you dont mind a 15 minute drive from disneyland. we are pass holders so we dont need to stay next to the park. Enjoy

It was a clean hotel and Ana was sweet at the front desk, as well a another girl [forgot her name].  The rooms were spacious, wifi was excellent , pillows were great, and the bathrooms were clean and newly remodeled. The girls in the breakfast room were so kind and good coffee was served. I am the Author of "True Travel Tips"  youtube video or fcbk. And the "Bruery' is the way of the future to enjoy eating and a brew without emptying your

Summary Heading: Excellent everything, as far as I'm concerned!!
Summary: Everything was phenomenal!! A full breakfast with scrambled eggs and cheese, bacon, sausage, corned beef hash, fresh waffles, cereal, bagels, toast, fruits, yogurt, milk, OJ, apple juice, coffee, tea and more! Super fast internet and exceptionally nice and pleasant staff. Had 2 queen beds that felt like Tempurpedic's and were very comfy. Built in shower soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and hand soap dispensers on the walls in the bathroom was a cool touch and very convenient. Denny's is also attached to this motel and you get a 10% discount on your orders for being a hotel guest. Parking is plentiful, too. It's like the stars aligned just right for us. It was simply excellent everything for all four of us!

Though the price was high, it was a  comfortable stay I should say, few more amenities like water and shuttles to airport or Disney land. expected they would sell the tickets at least(though the ad poster for the tickets sales is still hanging around the lobby), they did not even maintain any maps for the place or any theme parks.

Clean hotel and the room was big and comfy, the breakfast was light and few items were presented but not bad quality. I would definitely stay there again as I got a very good deal for two nights.  the area is not the best thought.

This hotel has recently remodeled their guest rooms.  They were very nice and comfortable.  Staff was helpful and friendly.  There is a Denny's located in the front of the hotel which was good for having late meals.

One of the better Best Western hotels that I have stayed in. The personal that work at the hotel were very professional in all respects! I would recommend this Best Western to anyone considering a stay in the area.

I stayed here for a night and the price was lower than my other favorite hotels. The bed was comfy and the free breakfast was really good. The breakfast staff was also very friendly. Very quiet area. I may move to this city so spending some time here was nice to see what I may be in for.

We needed to return to the OC for business and family and researched which hotel would serve our needs.  As we were going to have business in West Covina and family in Carlsbad and Ladera Ranch we selected the location in Placentia.  I was surprised to find the location on par with Inn at Sedona but without the view.  When I had breakfast I was surprised that they had corned beef hash on the menu.

Nice staff, great breakfast, no need to stay in Anahiem when you can stay right here!  Rooms were clean and the hotel looked freshly renovated.  Plus you can see the Disneyland fireworks from the hotub!

Nice hotel and friendly staff. We got a free upgrade to jacuzzi room. Quiet convenient location close to Disney, big LCD tv, comfy bed and a spacious room.  Only minor was the small shower cabin.  Can recommend. Excellent value for money.

Room was on the 3rd floor.  Large and very clean.  The halls had been repainted and looked very fresh.  Bathroom was very large and the shower had a wonderful shower head. Only thing we both hated was the liquid soap dispensers both in the shower and at the sink.  It also held shampoo and conditioner. The toilet paper roller seemed to measure the amount you used. My husband finally took it off the roller. Employees at the front desk were kind of cold except on our last day when we met Anna.  She went out of her way to help us.  The breakfast room and selection of foods was great.

Stayed two nights. The room was dirty (carpet) about eights days after checking out a $600 change on our bank card for so called smoking and damage to the room. Tried for two weeks to talk to the GM Christina Lopez. Left more than ten messages with no response. Called corporate offices to complain. Still no response from Christina Lopez. She told cooperate she is refusing to call and discuss the matter. Be careful and don't provide your card number. Still fighting to get the $600 returned.

Perfect location for where we were going.  Friendly staff and clean. Plenty of parking. Easy access to freeways 91 & 57.  Breakfast was adequate.  One note you can hear people talking in hallways and the pillows are full and not soft.

Employees were very attentive and helpful.  Rooms are newly renovated.  Beds are very comfortable & bathrooms w/beautiful décor & glass tiles in shower surround.  Breakfast was FULL with hot freshly made waffles, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, hardboiled eggs, scrambled eggs, eggs as a frittata, breakfast potatoes, yogurt, oranges, bananas, juice, milk, coffee, & water.

I was unexpectedly surprised at the level of comfort and upgrades to this Best Western.  The hotel is beautiful, newly remodeled, clean and comfortable.  This Best Western changed my opinion of the hotel chain - I will stay here when I'm the area again!  Great value!

We were greeted with a smile. Easy check in. Comfort ale bed. Quiet room. A great nights sleep and an awesome quick breakfast. Was it the best breakfast inhale ever had, of course not but it had sausage bacon eggs hard boiled eggs bagels cereal milk coffee tea. Great value for the price. Not only will I go again but I have already booked my next stay!!

Great experience, room was ready at check in.  We did a late swim pool was quiet and clean.  Breakfast was served on time and had great presentation.  Everything was warm and we never had to wait ffor refill of breakfast items.  Ladies were on top of cleaning tables for other guests to sit.  Beds were so comfy.

At checking in they gave us a king room because that's what the reservation told them but they quickly changed the room to a double. Rooms were clean, large bathroom. Nice big beds. Breakfast buffet was very good, breakfast room staff was also very friendly. Nice to have a Denny's close by for lunch and dinner.  It is very close to the parks in Anaheim. They are close to the important freeways that will take you everywhere.

At the front desk, Ana was extremely helpful during my check-in and check-out times. The rest of the staff at the hotel was also just as friendly. It's not a luxury hotel so I didn't expect too much.   I usually book my hotels through, Hotels.com and unfortunately, I booked my hotel the night before my stay and when I got to the hotel and checked on the hotel through the website again, the price went down. So I was a little upset about that, and the fact that they can't do anything about that. I felt it was a little inconvenient to me since I have stayed at other hotels that would gladly try to see if they can do anything for me due to that happening.   My overall stay, I would recommend this hotel if you don't plan on staying in the hotel too much. The bed was comfy and clean.

Any question or concern was handled in a professional manner and from cleaning the front of the building {thank you Ron} to breakfast everything was covered well. Pool was a little small but was clean and hot tub/spa operated well. This little gem of a hotel kept us off the busy path near Disneyland, but was close enough to get to most anything, food, parks, shopping within minutes. Great value for the money !!  Ana, Miranda and Freddy did yeoman work at the front desk for me at every request. Pleasant and understanding to most situations I watched during my stay. Nancy and Lily worked particularly hard to bring

The free hot breakfast is very good. The staff is friendly and the location is perfect. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

This hotel was not far at all from the park about a 12 minute drive. Staff was extremely nice. We stayed in the second floor. Half of the floor was being remodeled, but you could not hear them working from our room. You can  tell our room was remodeled. Really nice room. Everything was clean. Bathrooms have soap, lotion, shampoo, and body wash dispensers.  My kids loved the breakfast. I was actually surprised with the all the choices they had for breakfast and they had a nice seating area for breakfast. Breakfast staff was extremely friendly. Great price for the rooms. We will definitely stay here again.

The hotel was nice and clean and the staff were very friendly and attentive.  However the mattress was broken down and the breakfast left a lot to be desired.  We also would have liked a shuttle to Disneyland, as that was the purpose of the trip.

Awesome stay. I didn't quite meet any of the staff but everything was perfect during our stay. Keep up the great work and if I ever return to the area I will definitely choose this hotel because of the ease of freeway access and quietness. Clean rooms and just a great sleep. Thanks guys!

I stayed here last night and my room was clean and very comfortable. ALL the front desk workers were friendly and wearing smiles every time I either needed help or just walking by. Also ALL the housekeepers were friendly and smiling when I walked by them without exception. I will stay here again when I'm back in the area. EVERYONE here made me feel welcome. If you stay in any hotel/motel just remember if you like how clean your room is please remember to leave a gratuity for housekeeping. It might not go to the one that fixed your room but it still is nice to help them out as everyone should know how hard they work for not a lot of money.

If you're looking for a place to stay in the Anaheim area, the Best Western is a solid choice. Nothing too fancy, but it's well kept and convenient, and has a great staff. Plus you can't beat the view of palm trees outside the window. The rooms are spacious; we had two comfortable queen beds and a sitting area-a good fit for our group of four. The breakfast room was also nice and the options plentiful with hot and cold items.

Went down for a quick trip , needed a place close by for fussiness the next day.  This was a perfect spot and will stay the next time we come down to do business again.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  thank you

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel just 15 minutes from Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here with 4 of my girlfriends for a birthday trip to Disneyland. The hotel is just off the highway, which was very convenient. They offer free breakfast in the morning, not amazing but it's free. The room we stayed in was clean but on the smaller side, but there was also 5 of us in one room. My only complaint was that when we used the pool, one afternoon, there was a woman there with 3 or 4 kids who were not guests of the hotel. We had seen them in the back of the parking lot, talking over the wall that surrounds the property to the people that lived on the other side. It was very shady. We let the front dest know that there were people in there that weren't guests but they didn't seem very concerned.

This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and each time it has been great! Its a 10 minute drive to the Disneyland Parks. The breakfast is good especially when trying to eat quickly and get to the parks. Beds were super comfortable. Shower heads were tall which is always a plus for us, as my husband and I are both fairly tall!

Hotel is just minutes from Cal State Fullerton.  If you have a student there, this is not a bad place to stay.  Only complaint I have is when I called to dispute a charge, manager was no where to be found and the staff was kind of clueless as to this persons whereabouts.  They did not ask for a number or offer any help.  Otherwise, the hotel is a good place and a good value.

Summary Heading: Excellent option for this category of hotel
Summary: If you are looking to stay at this type of hotel (budget hotel versus full service hotel) I can highly recommend this property. The rooms are clean, recently renovated and spacious.   The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The located is good - close to highway 57. The breakfast was good for this type of hotel.  The two staff members at the breakfast were proactive toward helping guests and taking care of requests.  The pool is very small, but I didn't have time for a swim anyway.   Nice property and we will stay here again for sure.

The hotel is very nice and the staff is excellent.  If you are doing multiple activities in the Orange County area the location of this hotel is perfect.  It is also a very short drive to the Disneyland Resort area.  We will definitely stay here again.

Staff went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was comfortable.  We really appreciated it. The only down side was that the breakfast room was very crowded and it was difficult to get to the food so only took some coffee.  It was really good looking food.

We stayed in a first floor room near the breakfast room. If you can avoid the first floor, do so in the near future.  My bathroom had a good amount of mold in it.  The front desk clerk said they were renovating and hadn't gotten to the first floor yet.  I think the rooms with mold should not be available to stay in.  They can have mold removed or treated without renovating, and that showed me 2 things.  The owner does not care and doesn't want to spend the money.  The building may be on a slant, because neither the bathroom door or the closet door would stay half closed, it would swing on its own.  The mattresses were very soft.  They were very thin and the hotel placed a 3-inch thick piece of foam between the mattress and box spring.  The room had 2 queens, and you couldn't sit

A great value for the money. Nice and clean, and a good breakfast too ! Great location for most area attractions. We stayed in a King suite, and it was very nice. The bed was firm, but comfortable. The A/C worked great !!!. We would stay here again.

I had a very pleasant stay at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Orange County Hotel. Although not centrally located, it offers good freeway access and is pretty close to Disneyland. I found the room pleasant and clean with nice (if a bit worn) furnishings. It had a hot tub to the left of the living area (weird place for one) and the bathroom was very nice. The bed was comfortable and the hotel itself was quiet (set back a bit from the major roads). The breakfast was ... edible, but there are plenty of alternatives (including a restaurant near the parking lot) that offer better fare.   For my purposes and the price I paid, it was a great choice for a pleasant hotel in the OC area and I'd definitely stay again.

Although mileage is a short distance from DISNEYLAND, the actual commute time averages 10-15min-freeway travel and 20-25mi. backstreets. This can make for very long days in the park if you choose not to travel back and forth.

I stayed here with my family because it was close to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Best Western Plus was much cheaper than hotels right next to Disneyland.  It was a very nice and well-kept hotel and was away from a lot of noise and chaos!  I would defiantly go there again!

First off, We walk into the room and it has a disgusting musty smell. You can tell they are aware of it because they leave the window cracked. I didn't realize the window was cracked until the next morning and I stayed there alone (female) on the ground floor and they didn't even bother to let me know that it was open. Someone could have easily took off the screen and broke into my room. The only reason I found out it was open all night was because they have a lounge area right out side the rooms and people were talking outside my room all night. I did sound louder than usual so I went to check in the morning and sure enough the window was wide open.   Breakfast was included and was alright so we checkout. We only were there for one night so it wasn't worth making a fuss over.

Ok service but did not need to be upset over bill.  The employees need to understand the customers feelings and not be be unprofessional.  I am going to fight the last night of our stay and will not change the amount I was promised.

My room was clean, bed was comfortable, close to disneyland and Honda centre where we watched Imagine dragon concert. Just next to Denny's, so very easy to get breakfast, lunch or dinner. Parking was free. Receptionist was friendly.

Check in was good, I didn't much care for the $100 deposit they required seemed kinda tacky for such a nice hotel (it was refunded promptly to my card at check out), that may have been due to the check in counter person's personality and the way she stated it was required. All in all I liked the place, clean rooms wonderful breakfast buffet. I'd stay there again if thru that way!

Summary Heading: Old Hotel in Need of Repairs but Good Deal
Summary: I had requested a room on the upper level. but we were given a room on the first floor facing the parking lot.  As such, we had to keep the curtains closed while in the room.  Although our room appeared to be clean, it is in dire need of repairs.  The carpet was frayed and my husband stepped on a carpet tack or something sharp sticking out of the frayed area.  The wallpaper in the bathroom had black spots, possibly mold.  This was also evident in the shower.  I believe those were the only problems with the room.  Our room had a king size bed which was pretty comfortable.  The pillows were also nice.  The room also has a whirlpool tub, mini fridge and microwave.  There was a dresser and closet that provided plenty of space for clothing.  The bathroom is very small so it is not

This Best Western Plus is probably chosen for its location. The rooms are fine, some with Jacuzzi-style bathtubs. Desk and comfortable chair with ottoman for comfort. Clean and well managed with great staff. Very limited dining nearby. Dennys right next door. Must have car to get around.Small pool and exercise room.Very large breakfast selection starting at 6 a.m.

We stayed at this hotel because it was close to our family that we were in town to visit. It is a great little hotel and a good bang for your buck. The breakfast was surprising good with a waffle station and a nice selection of breakfast food. We are looking forward to staying here again.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for 1 night or several
Summary: I always try to stay at the Best Western Plus in Anaheim, not to go to Disneyland - it's very close to Disneyland - but I stay because when I visit my kids and grandkids, they don't have room so I stay here.  Very nice, clean, comfortable and safe.

Stayed for one night. Great staff. Service was quick and easy checking in & out. Very clean with a nice lobby area. Would stay again if I was in the area. Very nice and comfy rooms with classy decor. Loved the look and feel of the rooms.

This is a very nice place to stay and has a fitness centre too!  We stayed there twice as it was so nice, great rooms, nice service and good breakfast with hot food.  Enjoyed our stay.  We did try and change the date of our second stay to one night back, but they would not change the booking (as we did it online) which we thought was a bit tough.

The place smelled of smoke and mold.  I let the front office know.  No offer to change rooms or nothing.  The carpets were filthy.  The bathtub had mold. or needed repair.  The mold smell was in bathroom and closet.  The bed was way too soft.  I have stayed in BWPlus in Yuma, Az - Outstanding!  In Wickenburg, Az. - Outstanding.  The good things - the pool and Jacuzzi.

Not gonna lie..we contemplated leaving the moment we got there but despite the bad first impression due to the area and the scary "business"/trailer park next door we decided to stay. I recommend the King Junior Suite on the top floor. The room is spacious, very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very nice and the service speedy. You must have car if you want to stay here but the main  attractions are very close without taking any hwys. Yorba Linda Blvd is 5 minutes away and you will find lots of resturants/coffee shops/grocery stores and this really cute farmers market on Tuesdays. Across the street (about 5 minutes walking) was "The Bruery" this really cool spot to meet some locals and have some California beer. This is a great hotel for those who require a

This hotel is located 15min driving from Disneyland parks, we wanted to stay within walking distance to the park but we could not find anything the days we wanted. This hotel is fine if you are only going to sleep after a long day at the parks, is not very spacious or luxurious, but it definitely has what you need. Breakfast is good, they have a few options and waffles, all the basics nothing fancy. The personnel is great, they all have a smile when you approach them and they look to help out. The only conn we found is that the room was smelling like old furniture but nothing major, the wifi was very slow, my wife tried to upload a few pictures to facebook and it took forever, but again, not a big deal breaker for us.

ok place to stay for the night, not much excitement. also the guest rooms are presented less than the pictures you would see online. The breakfast staff was great, very pleasant. the food was good.  I would probably use this hotel if there are no other better choices. I have not stayed in a best western before so I was curious how the hotel was.

Have stayed at this hotel numerous times as is close to my mother's nursing home. Always very nice people at check in, check out, and breakfast. Our room has been upgraded the last 4 or 5 times staying there. Not a lot of meal choices close by, but get by as Denny's is adjacent.

I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last two years.  I like the fact it is away from freeway noise.  The freeways are close by and have easy access.  My room was clean and the bed comfortable.  I had a few problems this time, but they were handled quickly by the staff. Every staff member treated we with friendliness and a smile. I will stay here again.

Repairs being made directly across my room. -  pounding and banging going on most of the day. Cleaning staff -  no regard either for controlling the noise level - hit my door with their cart/vacuum so often I thought they wanted me to leave -initially I actually thought someone was at my door knocking (opened door to see cleaning cart)  it was awful!  The walls are no help - shower and flushing heard from level above and next door...and most of everything else.....including the entire family they put next to me. Oh yes the mattress (on both beds) moves right of the edge of  the bottom mattress.

Stayed for business and loud,dirty and uncomfortable. The construction next very loud and had to move rooms after long travel. I think the Holiday Inn would have been better. They did move us as I said but the food was really nasty!

We were in the area for the regional baseball tournament at CSUF.  We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived late at night.  The lobby is nice and welcoming.  Our room was very nice.  The decor was tasteful and the room comfortable.  The breakfast is pretty good with a good selection to include waffles.  The ladies working in the breakfast area during our stay were very helpful, friendly and kept the whole place clean.  The grounds are well maintained.  All employees we encountered were professional and pleasant.   The hotel is set behind a Denny's restaurant (very convenient) which means there is no street traffic to deal with.

Very nice and quite!! Only 6 minutes to Disneyland!! The rooms are nice size and the staff very friendly. I will definitely stay here again!!!  Going to make this one of our favorite place to stay!! Love that they have a Denny's right in the parking lot!

Replace the managers they were rude to us, we ask for another night price we ask why so much and the manager offensive said well we have to make money somehow! Then as we enter our room it was clean but no clean towel’s so I called the rude manager and ask for some, He told to come down and get them myself, I said I am a disable person 15 minutes later he showed up. We will never stay there again we will tell others

Went on a quick get away trip to Anaheim for the weekend with a  friend who flew in for the weekend. Hotel was very welcoming upon arrival. My friend and I were both astounded about how nice it was especially for the price. Our room was great as well. Two king beds that were super comfy. Room was slightly cramped, but we managed. Only concern was the dark mold looking stuff in the bathtub, but it was quickly over looked due since I was just happy to have a private shower for a change. I would definitely stay here again if in the area.

No problems. Room was clean, was a handicapped accessible room even though I didn't ask for or need one. The only thing even close to an "issue" was that the coffee maker was missing the carafe and when I let the front desk know, I felt the person on duty acted in a condescending manner and said that it was probably a single cup maker. I've stayed in numerous hotels/motels over the years and I know the difference. If I had put one of the provided Styrofoam cups on the obvious burner plate, it would have melted and caused a potentially serious hazard. Even the directions on the maker showed a carafe. She should have known the difference. Small issue and was a little disappointed it wasn't looked into, but I would recommend and will probably stay there again due to family in the

Easy access off the highway 57.. Nested right behind a Denny's Restaurant.  The rooms are average, the beds are comfortable.  The hotel is very clean. The rooms are not real large. They have an average free breakfast in a small kitchen area.  It consisted of egg omelettes with cheese inside, waffles, cereals, coffee, orange juice, bread, fresh oranges, and bread. Parking was free. The young lady in the kitchen room was very pleasant and very helpful to the numerous patrons but, we didn't feel the people at the front desk were as friendly as some other hotels we've experienced throughout our travels. We had a minor problem with the sink and they were there in under 5 minutes and fixed it right away. There is a private pool area and a couple of tables and several lounge chairs.

Summary Heading: Quality Hotel With a Professional Staff
Summary: I try to stay at this property every time I'm in the area. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, with excellent internet. The breakfast is very good and the breakfast area is keep remarkably clean. There is a Denny's restaurant in front of the property, and another nice restaurant within walking distance called Tom's Place. Property is very quiet because it's set 2 blocks of the freeway.

About average in terms of what I expected.  The hotel is definitely the budget option for those who are visiting Disneyland or taking in a game or event at one of the nearby sporting venues. I found the hotel rather loud in terms of hallway noise and water running through the pipes when a guest below used the shower or toilet.   Beyond that I'd suggest requesting a room facing west, since we had view facing a dirt lot from the third floor on the east side of the hotel. Also, there was painting going on at the far end of the hotel where we were staying so accessing the stairwell was tricky during certain parts of the day. The breakfast was step above in terms of service and choices.  Definitely a nice little touch.

Summary Heading: Clean, but lacks pride of ownership
Summary: The owner/manager needs to show pride of ownership.  The hallways were painted some time ago with a roller.  Unfortunately, they did not mask off the baseboards, thus there are paint roller marks all along the hallway. It would have taken just a little effort to either mask off the baseboards or come back and paint the baseboards.  The visual effect is not what I want to see in a hotel.  This lack of attention to detail make me wonder about their attention to detail elsewhere.  The second issue was a 4 inch square opening in the drywall of the ceiling in the closet.  Again, if access was needed to the overhead pipes, then put in an access panel.  The result was that hot attic air blew down into the attic where our clothes were stored.  I think that this is probably a fire code

This hotel was perfect I loved every second and the beds are super comfy. Breakfast was acutely really good they even grill your waffles for you and I'm pretty sure this building is super new cause even the elevator is in pristine shape. Overall I love it

For the price of this hotel our stay was wonderful. There was a great breakfast the hotel itself was very clean.   On another note, the housekeeping staff apparently doesn't know how to clean a room. They came in and made one of the two beds in the room. They didn't wipe or clean any of the surfaces and they didn't vacuum the carpets either. When I complained they brought more towels. I'm not sure how this solves the issue of cleaning a hotel room.   Despite the housekeeping issues, the stay was great.

Summary Heading: Close enough to Anaheim if you have a car
Summary: We stayed here for a convention at anaheim - as we had a car it was great - good value much cheaper to stay than being in Anaheim and only 15 minutes drive . However with a car, you're kinda stuck with an occasional bus or taxi.. Breakfast & wifi included . The room was comfortable and large. My room pone didn't work and the commitment to fix it never happened.  I was happy to rate this place a Very Good but their lack of service when I needed it was appalling.  My fault entirely but when I got back to Australia I realised I had left my suit trousers in the closet. My request was simple , could you please go the 1.8 miles down the road to the post office and post them to me - then charge my credit card. 2 colleagues and I had just spent $1500 there . One would have thought it a

Summary Heading: Used to stay here, but not again.
Summary: We used to stay at this hotel and in past gave it a 5 rating.  We did note that some who stayed at the hotel complained of noisy water pipes from showers in other rooms.  We now understand.  It was the 1st time we stayed in room 203-A as noted on our bill, so perhaps the concern is limited to that area of the hotel.  It is not a minor noise, earplugs are needed if trying to sleep.  We called down to front desk and were told that guests normally don't shower for that long, so it should be quiet soon.  Problem was that this occurred twice after we wished to be asleep and on both nights we stayed at the hotel.  This was enough for us to no longer stay despite everything else being fine on previous visits.  Not sleeping well is huge when rating a hotel.  Since others have also noted

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, clean rooms & attentive staff
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on a recent business trip.  Everything about it was accommodating.  From the front desk staff to the warm and inviting room décor, the hotel made the trip an enjoyment.  This is not your typical Best Western Hotel.  This hotel is clearly a steps above the rest.

Had everything I needed for that stay. Breakfast OK and friendly service. Waffles,eggs,  breads, fruits, juices, muffins and great coffee. I saw the manager meeting with the staff and noticed that the atmosphere was very cordial and informative. I congratulated him.

Nice place to stay real comfortable beds, hard to find,quite location easy and free parking a big plus for the California area.Location was good but not easy to locate it's tuck away behind the Denny's, but nite signage made it easier to locate.

Everything was great at this hotel.  The complementary breakfast was the best I've ever had, the women working in the breakfast area was awesome.  The room was large, clean and comfortable.  No complaints here.

The best thing you can say about a hotel is if you are willing to return.  And we always do.  The staff is always a pleasure to work with.  The hotel and rooms are spotless. The location perfect.  Less than 10 minutes to Disneyland, Honda Center, Convention Center, Angel Stadium, etc. Easy access to the freeway. Restaurant right next door makes meals easy if you are on the go. Lots of free parking. Best value in Anaheim.

The third floor had recently been renovated when I visited.  Three others in my party with seperate rooms - all were satisfied.  Rooms were very nice and nicely appointed.  They had fridges, but no microwaves.  The only real bad thing at this hotel (I've stayed here 3 times in the last 4 years) is the breakfast - it sucks.  The eggs and sausage are like rubber due to being frozen and the orange juice (?) tastes like flavored and dilluted water.  You can survive on the breakfast (family budget), but don't expect to be impressed.  Overall, very nice hotel.  I will stay here again, but we eat at the Denny's that's 50 feet in front of it!

For a good room rate, I can overlook many flaws with out complaining... However, when I got home from my trip I noticed some extra charges on my credit card. When I called, they said the charges were for stains on a washcloth??? I don't recall any stains but even if there were, I just spent hundreds of dollars for my stay, I think that should cover a 25 cent wash cloth! I disputed the charge and asked to have it refunded but they refused. It's my word against theirs. I guess I should be glad it was under $10 and not $100. I wonder if it was retaliation from housekeeping for not leaving a big enough tip?  The hotel itself is okay. The rooms were a little cramped and the carpet was dirty. None of the staff that I met spoke English as their first language. They seemed almost

Meh.... (I hate giving bad reviews) This was really a last minute work/ job interview related work thing out of state. I had some job interviews lined up in the Anaheim/ Irvine/ area and just need a place to stay. Normally, I'm super selective, but time was against me and this would do. There is plenty of parking, I am more use to the Costa Mesa, Newport Beach area when I stay in CA for my interviews. So, why here?? My thoughts exactly, I have never even heard of the city. I arrived early and normally hotels have your room ready.. not here. Went to Fashion Island and came back 2 hours later. The hallway looked like the from a CIS crime investigation. Dirty, unlabeled walls, ( renovations?) and the carpet was super dirty. Standard room, king bed. I found dust EVERYWHERE and the

The hotel is nice, hidden behind Denny's. Service was okay . room was clean , there was a slight odor. The stay was perfect for what I had to do around the city .Don't look for luxury , there where children there so I would say def. a Family place pool, hot tub, and an actually good breakfast.

I often visit Disneyland and California Adventure.  I choose this hotel when I am only going to be staying for one day as its only approximately a 10 minute drive to the park and often significantly cheaper than the other hotels which are on the main street outside of Disney.  Given that I need to park anyway the proximity is not an issue, it just means setting off a few minutes earlier.  The pool is heated, the hotel is very clean and the breakfast is regularly checked and topped up.  A good example of the Best Western brand which I use a lot.

We stayed at this hotel two separate times .  The first time was good. The second time was not.  It seems to be good about half of the time.  The breakfast bar was skimpy and picked through all the times we stayed there.  So much so that we went out to eat the last stay, just to be satisfied.  The staff help graciously the first time, but failed miserably the second.

This was a groupon purchase. $84 out the door. Would purchase from again. Needed for a quick trip to Disneyland. Please be aware. It is not on the ART service route. We drove our own car and it is roughly 10 minutes without traffic. Hotel was clean throughout. Easy parking. Easy checkin. Easy checkout. Not the worlds best morning breakfast but wasn't bad. The girls working the room were EXCELLENT. Prepared waffles kept the area clean. Breakfast was egg chees omelette. Biscuits and gravy. Cereal. Yogurt. Toast. Bagels. The basics but the price can't be beat. Feel safe booking here. Our experience was great. The only negative. The "fitness" room is really only 3 cardio machines and an old multi use weight machine. Needs more equipment to be purposeful.

The BW in Placentia is very clean, staff is friendly/pleasant.  The breakfast is great, better than the average "free breakfast".  The menu changes daily, and you can always have the waffles (which are my favorite) yogurts, fruit and bagels/toast.  The hotel is dated, although while we were there there were some renovations going on.  The price is well worth it.  I travel back and forth to OC often, and I will be coming back to the BW in Placentia.  I only wish I would have known about this hotel earlier.  I cannot stress enough how pleasant, helpful and friendly all of the staff at the BW in Placentia is.

Stayed here on a business trip and it was much less expensive than other choices in the area.  The hotel and room was nice, very clean, quite and spacious.  The room and bed was comfortable.  The biggest issue was the wifi in my room (#116).  It would drop about every 1-2 minutes - on my phone, laptop and tablet.  I called the network company but it wasn't fixed.  I had to go to lobby and every worked great and had good bandwidth.  My friend had good reception in his room so it might just be my room.  Breakfast was OK but not great - scrabbled eggs or omelets, waffle, cereal.  If would be great if they had cooked oatmeal or a high fiber cereal choice.    Gym was acceptable and never anyone in there.  They had treadmill, elliptical, recumbent bike and universal weight set.    TV

As soon as I walked in the door the Hotel smelled clean. The floors were clean and shiny. I wanted to check in early as I was going to Medieval Times for a dinner show at 3:30pm and I arrived at 1:45pm at the hotel and the staff at the front desk was very friendly and said it was not a problem and let me check in early. I took the elevator to the second floor and noticed as I was walking past the chandelier in the lobby I noticed that the top it  was clean no dust the fire alarms had no dust on them. I got to my room and it  smelled clean, not like they spray something in the air as Motel 6 does. The bathroom was clean and shining. the Sheets were bright white and smelled clean the blankets even smelled clean. The next morning I went down for breakfast they had bacon eggs

Great size of rooms and great breakfast in the morning. Overall good experience would go back, especially if you are planning on going to Disneyland because it is only about a ten minute drive on a highway away but it's worth it for the great price and size/comfort of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Are you going to Disneyland? Don't stay here!
Summary: This place is awful! It was on groupon and advertised as close to Disneyland.  Some things you need to know: -the staff here appeared to go out of their way to be unhelpful and rude -It is not actually close to Disneyland -You cannot store your luggage here -the front desk staff are actively unhelpful. I know I said that above, but it's really important -they do not have a shuttle to Disneyland and they are off the shuttle route for Disneyland shuttles -the breakfast is very limited and has very few healthy options - the walls are so thin that you can hear the exact words of the people in the room beside you. We could hear the toilet flushing next door. -long story short - avoid this hotel at all costs.

Had to move out of home two days.  Booked two nights on emergency basis at this location because it was close to home.  Very convenient parking and peaceful surrounding.  The easiest check-in and check-out ever!  Short staff but very helpful.  Had two quiet nights to rest at this very tranquil hotel.

I stay at best western any time i travel. There pricing and quailty never lets me down. There is always a best western near where i need to be. will always book Best Western if i can. One of the things i like best about Best Western is their breakfast  i do not have to leave to to have to have a great breakfast.

We have stayed here many times now and we have always had a Great stay :) The staff has always been friendly and helpful. Were planning on staying here once a month if We can. I would tell my friends to stay here.

The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and so polite.  We had some a special request upon check in and it was all taken care of when we arrived.  Which almost never happens especially when we arrived late.  It looks like they are doing renovations but even that area was kept neat.

Summary Heading: Excellent for travelling with babies - our new favorite SoCal hotel!
Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel if you are travelling with a baby! I was just looking for a good deal, the price for this hotel was great, but the room was awesome. It has a living room space and a wall of separation between the bedroom and living room. It was a big room, and perfect for putting the baby down and letting mom and dad stay up past 7:30! It also had 2 TV's with DirectTV. One morning the baby and I watched the baby channel in the bedroom while dad watched sports in the living room! There is also a fridge and microwave and the continental breakfast was nice - was enough to get us started in the morning without taking a baby to a restaurant. It's also very nice from the outside and in a decent neighborhood - I felt very safe with the baby there. It wasn't a super

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland without the resort prices!
Summary: Bed 3/5 Mattress was firm (rating 5 for soft and 1 for hard)  Room 4/5 Room was very clean. Just renovated.  Desk area and clock. Room has two flat screen TVs, lots of outlets, wall unit AC, refrigerator and microwave. Shower warmed up moderately, decent pressure and drained well.   Proximity 4/5 Close to the Disneyland (about a 15 minute drive). Close to UC Fullerton. Lots of fast food options within a 2 mile radius.   Price $$   Overall -Free Internet. Free  parking. Free breakfast at hotel. Also Dennys next door to hotel  This review is for a Jr Suite. If booked at the right time this place is a steal for the area. Very friendly staff!

This was my fourth stay in a little over a year.Very unusual for me. I feel safe and well taken care of here. The staff is friendly and helpful and my room was very comfortable.  While only a couple of blocks from the freeway, it is a pleasure to stay in a room that  you don't have to worry about the noise from the freeway.  There is Denny's in front of the hotel so  you don't have to drive to get food..  My only complaints are that the lighting in the room is dim and the shower is moldy. After I complained about the shower, it was cleaned for me. I will stay there again.  Thank you to the staff and manager for for making my stays a very good experience.

This hotel was within a decent  distant from the Disneyland property. (8 min drive) Price was within range of most hotels in the area. Parking and hotel access good. Hotel was quite and comfortable. Room standard 2-queen beds, very comfortable.   However, not vacuumed daily. Beds made, towels changed, trash cans emptied only.  Room furniture arrangement very cramped.    A few simple adjustments to location and size could solve the problem.      Daily morning breakfast was decent and breakfast room comfortable. Staff in breakfast room very cordial and helpful. Hotel does have a 24-hr. restaurant next door.     Overall, I would stay at this property again. Standard experience.

Terrible moldy smell emanating from sink in bedroom area. Terrible mold all around the shower! Rather surprised that they book this room in this condition!  This is not what we have experienced at this hotel previously.
