Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future.   Our renovations now include new bathroom and other enhancements that will guarantee a comfortable stay. We look forward to another opportunity to welcome you again.   Sincerely,  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.

The carpet was frayed in several places. The shower has black mold growing inside and outside of it. When I notified the front desk of my concerns of the black mold I was told they could move us then next day. After returning from dinner we discovered there was no hot water. After a trip back to the front desk we were eventually moved to the 3rd floor.

Please call us for reservations and to learn about the new BW Rewards Promotion.   Sincerely,  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County.

Summary Heading: A good sleep and a good breakfast for the masses
Summary: Do not kid yourself.  This is NOT a place where you come to demand customer service or perks.  This is a facility where you come to sleep and get a decent breakfast for 70 bucks at night.  My heart goes out to the two girls who serve breakfast who, despite the masses of people who come basicaly to get a good chow (and it is decent, you even get bacon, sausages and eggs) have the kindness to keep smiling when somebody comes with some unreasonable request thinking this is the Hilton.  I sent several packages before my arrival and they were there when I arrived at midnight.  The bed is comfortable, the room is large and IT EVEN HAS A JACUZZI!!!!!  For 70 bucks???  Come on, it ain´t pretty but it sure does it job.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a Great Price
Summary: Normally I stay at a different Hotel when I'm in Anaheim with the family. This time it was for work, so we looked for the best value and proximity to our job. The room was clean and up to date. It came with a large flat screen tv. The beds were very soft and comfortable. I'm a pretty big guy, so the high shower head with good water flow is always appreciated. THe hotel featured a hot breakfast which is a cut above the normal continental breakfast of other hotels. Cheese omelet, bacon, biscuits and gravy, and of course waffles made for a good start to the day.

The hotel was VERY quiet unlike those closer to Disney where folks are coming and going from the park from early in the morning until well after Downtown Disney shopping closes.  There are renovations ongoing, but this did not bother us.  They are largely done.  Didn't use any services at hotel, and not even sure it they have them (pool, fitness center etc.)  No concerns with water etc. noted by others.  We were in room 208.  High praise for the young gals working in the breakfast area.  They, unlike some of the other staff working that area, made rounds to quests at tables making sure everyone had what they

We have been here before and the rooms are always clean and couldn't ask for more. Summary: Accidentally booked this hotel instead of the one on City Center Drive and was happy with the error.  It was only 7 miles away and easy to get to.  I only paid $65 a night for a nice room and an OK breakfast (eggs, waffles,bacon bagels,fruit,yogurt and cereal. It is kinda off the beaten path but it  is close to freeways and there is a Denny's on site.  It was very quite, clean and the employees were all friendly. The one thing I would change is a longer shower curtain. It barely covered the side of the tub so water splashed out while showering....but  I would stay here again if the price were the same.

Best regards,  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

I looked at my credit card account and saw that I had a charge for $20.00 from the hotel. I called them and they said that I "damaged" one of their towels. I didn't even take a shower! They didn't even ask me if it was ok to charge my card nor did I get a bill when I checked out! I called American Express and they refunded my money. I will never do business with this location again.

To top if off, they kept the 100 dollar deposit stating that we destroyed one of the bedsheets and a towel, the bedsheet supposably had a nail polish stain, we never used nail polish in the stay and we brought our own blankets because we refuse to use any hotels blankets. So, I anticipated a short drive from Disney. Little did I know, we had to hop back on the freeway & had about a 10-15 minute drive after a long day at the park. Bummer! I should have checked it out on the map before confirming. However, I made the reservation from my phone & I knew availability was limited. So, I trusted the agents knowledge. When we arrived late that night at the hotel, the agent said we booked a room with 2 beds. Not true & showed him my reservation for a king bed. Somehow, he found us the right room when I told him he would have to comp the room if we were stuck with the 2 beds.

It was a good price and the beds we SUPER comfortable.  We had 4 people staying in a 2 queen room and it was more than enough space for all of us and was quiet so we could get some good sleep for our Disney Adventure we were on.  In the mornings they serve breakfast and it was actually really good. They had eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, chorizo and potatoes, plus cereal, waffles, toast, bagels, yogurt, juice, and milk. We all were able to get a good fill of food before heading out to Disneyland for the day. The parking lot was also nice, enclosed and seemed really safe for my car which i liked.  There was also a Denny's in front

Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.

The hotel was in pretty good condition, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The only thing was the shower was a little bit old looking but besides that everything was good. The hotel was in a little bit of a rough area but we never felt nervous or in danger. It was a great hotel for spending little time there, we pretty much only slept because we were at Disneyland the entire time. We did not have the breakfast so I can't say if it was good or not but there is a Denny's in the

We spent so little money, had so much in return, they know about service. All employees showing care, the cleaning ladies very sweet.  Will be coming back for sure...

Guest satisfaction is important to us and we try our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding experience at our hotel. As our success is measured by how our guests evaluate our services and facilities, we want you to know that our pricing is the start on this partnership.   We look forward to your upcoming stay.   Sincerely,  Christina L.  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: We had a terrible time getting some bedding for the sleeper couch for our daughter. It took about an hour and a half to get a blanket and a pillow for the couch. The breakfast was not being restocked and many people were waiting for anything to eat. Ended up with just a small yogurt for breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for your preference. Our commitment is to deliver great service and to provide resolutions to your needs and expectations.  All of our rooms with a sofa sleeper feature an extra set of pillow and blanket in the room. I am sorry that we delayed the delivery of an extra blanket and pillow. Our summer season was of great demand and some of our services had a minute delay in being presented to our guests.  Our breakfast room was a very popular meeting point; our customer enjoy the space and served items that suggested our hotel to extend the breakfast hours. During the weekend and Holidays the breakfast room closes at 10am. In the future, please feel free to request our host to assist you with any extra items; they will be happy to serve you and your family.  Thank you again for your preference and kind feedback.   Sincerely,   Christina L.  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.

Summary Heading: Really Amazing Deal for Disneyland Trips!
Summary: We booked a 6-night stay through Groupon. At $55/night, this was a steal! Anything close to Disneyland was over $100, including Motel 6. Free wifi, full hot breakfast included, and a mini fridge, with bed, furnishings and decor comparable to hotels in a higher bracket, this was an amazing deal. There is a Denny's within the parking lot as well, ample parking and it's only 15 minutes to Disneyland. If you purchase tickets at a AAA location, they include complimentary theme park parking so this was a no brainer.  Located in a quiet area, we had no issues until the very last night when the room next to us sounded rowdy. A simple call to the front desk solved the issue promptly. The service was excellent, staff warned them and followed up with us saying if there were any more noise
Manager Response: Humble greetings and much thanks for your review.  Our hotel is delighted in offering options to our guests on our partner sites; welcoming new guests to discover our services and amenities. Our offers include all of the services families need. Free Breakfast, Free Parking and a guest room that is serviced daily. Our outdoor, heated pool gives more of a relaxing time with friends and family.  Please check our Best Western Brand hotel to find similar offer.  Thank you again and we look forward to welcoming you very soon!   Sincerely,  Christina L.  Best Wester PLUS Anaheim Orange County

Summary: I stayed at this hotel mid August 2014 for 3 days.  The first two nights I was bitten repeatedly by bedbugs with over 35 bites in my arms, head torso and legs. The bites did not show until the second day of my stay since my reaction to the bites was delayed.  When I approached the front desk with my situation the clerk simply gave me a separate room in a different floor but did not say anything about the bedbug situation in the hotel.  The bed bug infested room was on the first floor close to the reception.  Additionally, I noticed that the hotel retained the $100 security deposit from my stay.  I am now disputing this additional charge with my credit card and the hotel and will update the review depending on the outcome of the dispute.  I was never informed as of why the hotel

Besides the hour wait for a room/not ready until 4pm. The room was average and a good room for the price.  Nothing great but nothing to complain about. A good motel near where we wanted.  It's hard to stay in that area with all of the Disneyland traffic raising rates.
Manager Response: Thank you for your preference and sharing your experience during your stay with us.  Please accept my most sincere apologies to the delay in receiving a room assigned for your stay. It is imperative to have all items in good condition for your comfort.  Our staff will take care of the situation and will train on getting the rooms available at our normal check in time of 3:00pm.  Your patience and participation on this portal is greatly appreciated.   We look forward to seeing you very soon,   Sincerely,  Christina L.  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary Heading: Good hotel to spend the night
Summary: We wanted a hotel not too far from Disneyland but not as expensive as the ones in Anaheim. The price we paid was great but the room smelled funny and the hotel is showing its age. The beds were very comfortable, though, and breakfast was fine. That was the main purpose of being there.
Manager Response: Hello and much Thanks for your comments about your stay with us.  Disneyland, Knott's, local beaches and most attractions are minutes away. We are delighted in welcoming all guests planning vacation trips with family and friends.  Our goal is to make each stay a pleasant and comfortable stay at accessible prices.  The property will begin a project to enhance some areas to show our plans for modern and fresh quality in our guest rooms and public areas.  I invite you to come back and see our improvements.   Kind regards,   Christina L.  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary Heading: Feel cheated, a Sofa bed =\= a real bed.
Summary: Rude front desk staff. Booked through Hotwire and wasn't informed of having to have a $100 deposit.   The biggest reason I'd never stay again is that they're trying to pass off a room with a tiny, thin, old, unusable hide-a-bed sofa as a "double" room. It's got exposed metal hinges and parts making it unsafe for my small children and its too small for my 6'4" husband and my 5'8" self to sleep in.   We travel a lot. I've use Hotwire to book rooms all the time. This is the only time when  I feel completely cheated and unhappy.   I plan on checking out early, even though I'll eat the cost of two nights stay and NEVER stay at a BW hotel again. I need adequate, safe, sleeping space.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on TripAdvisor!  I am sorry you feel the room you received is less than expected. Our third party partners work ardously to inform in detail about the amenities offered; however some rate plans only secure an offer or promotional price.  We encourage all of our guests to make reservations on our third party partner portals to take advantage to some internet packages and great deals.Also, the hotel offers options of upgrade to accommodate your needs.   Please visit our Best Western Brand Website for specific services; You will find options to our different room types and special discount meeting every budget and keeping essential services. Guests have responded extraordinarily to some of the offers reserved via partner websites. Once again, thank you for your patronage and thank you for giving us the opportunity of welcoming you back to our Best Western Branded Hotels.   Sincerely,  Christina L. Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.

Summary: This is the second time we have stayed here and it has been great each time.  Great value and service for your money.  Would stay here again.  Also has great location and was a quiet hotel.  Service was excellent.  Breakfast a bit bland but yogurt and toast were fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for your patronage and foremost, the opportunity to welcome you again.  Our hospitality promise is that our services and products will continue striving to higher levels of quality. Your feedback is the true voice of our customers, hightly important in our daily performance. Your contribution on this portal is the influence and valuable support to our guests.  Please contact us if you have any questions or would like further assistance with your upcoming reservations and any preference you find important for your stay.   With much gratitude,  Christina Lopez  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary Heading: Worst customer service I've ever received
Summary: Upon my arrival, I thought there was plenty of parking and the outside of the hotel had a nice clean appearance.  The lobby also looked very clean and well kept.  The front desk attendant Miranda was polite and helpful at check in but once I started walking to my room, the troubles began (see attached pictures).    Not once during the half dozen calls I made to the hotel before my arrival did anyone mention the hotel was being remodeled, nor was there anything on their website, a sign in their lobby, AND the front desk didn't say a thing.  I discovered it myself while I walked down the hallway to my room (with 2 children in tow) where there were tarps on the ground, paint on the walls, sections of the wallpaper missing, room numbers written on small pieces of paper and tapped on

Moreover, thank you for contacting our Customer Care experts; as agreed, remuneration is a tangible apology and a step forward and closer to meeting your expectations.  We encourage all of our guests to make reservations and receiving a confirmation letter to prevent any errors, our front desk agents are always on stand by to assist with reservations, questions and changes you may request. Sincerely,  Christina Lopez  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.

Summary: Great location, quiet hotel, great breakfast. Didn't use the pool or fitness room.  easy freeway access. friendly staff. stayed in a room with 2 kings and sofa with lots of room. air conditioning worked well, and not too noisy.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to participate with your experience at our hotel. We look forward to welcome you soon and invite you to contact us to make reservations.  Our heated pool, on site restaurant and ample free parking are some of the reasons to take an trip to Disney.  Thank you and look forward to welcoming you soon.   Sincerely  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hote

Summary Heading: Not very plus, not very accommodating
Summary: My husband asked for a quieter room, if possible on the upper (of the two) level; the desk clerk said "not for the price you paid" and assigned the room closest to the desk, with maximum foot traffic and noise.  Beware! This hotel's policy seems to be to discriminate against those who paid less through 3rd party sites such as Priceline, Hotels.com, Hotwire, and Booking.com. For that reason, the lack of customer service and response, it is poor. In addition, it is a bit run down.  Breakfast was a plus; didn't use any facilities such as work out or pool. Location is good for highway access.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience regarding your recent stay.  Our third party partners work ardously to inform in detail about the amenities offered; however if plans have changed after completing reservations, our customers have the option to upgrade to larger rooms or with more amenities. Sincerely,  Christina Lopez  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.

Summary: Handicap room reserved for person with one leg. Shower seat slippery. Adjustable shower head  was broken at the lower position rendering it useless. Shower drain did not work thereby flooding the ENTIRE bathroom floor causing very unsafe condition. Guest had to use towels to mop the entire floor. Guest had to mop bathroom floor everyday with the towels. The hotel also provided extra towels for guest to use as barrier to keep water out of the bathroom. The shower curtain was too short and did not reach the floor thereby profviding no benefit. Guest requested a room change the  next morning and was denied citing hotel was full. On Saturday, the room was not cleaned and towels were not replaced and all the towels had been used to mop the floor. Hotel claimed "Do Not Disturb" was on
Manager Response: Thank you for your choosing our property during your visit to the area. Please accept our sincerest apologies to any inconveniences you encountered during your stay. It is important that we met your expectations and that the area of concern is detailed on your feedback.  These specific comments are extremely useful when enhancing our services and keeping our amenities in full working order. Your concern and generous feedback provides us with opportunities to make our facilities a safe and secure environment for all of our guests. Our chief engineer and entire staff is conducting an assessment to determine a the steps to follow. If you have additional comments or questions, please contact me directly at the hotel local phone number listed on your invoice.   Once again, Thank you!   Christina Lopez  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: Great Staff, great lobby, Hotel is being remodeled, therefore it was dirty from construction dusts, etc..Ski the breakfast, it was  terrible. There's a Denny's out in front. Great room and bed. No water pressure in the shower.
Manager Response: Your business is very important to us and we value your feedback. By sharing your experience and what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, the hotel is being enhanced and although it is not fully in construction; we trust that the upgrades will make a difference to your upcoming stay.  Your experience and participation on this portal is helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. We hope you will come back and see us again soon.  We look forward to welcoming you again!  Sincerely,  Christina Lopez  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.

Summary Heading: A good alternative to hotels bordering Disney
Summary: This would be a good choice if you don't mind a short drive to the Disney parks (15 minutes).  The location is quieter but still in a good neighborhood , which suited us fine. Its also a hotel rather than an inn/motel, contrary to some of the hotels nearer to the parks.  A minor distinction, but we find hotels much better in general for family use. A lot of families using the hotel, plus some business travelers. Facilities are good, but our room was starting to show its age in small ways.  Nothing that was dangerous or bothersome though. Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your participation. Our Hospitality Promise has been extended to all the areas of our services promised to our clients. By telling us what you liked about your stay and how we can improve, you are helping us deliver a superior experience for you and other guests in the future. We hope you will come back and see us again soon.  Our property continues to improve and customer service development still on the works. Please visit us again very soon.   Sincerely,  Christina Lopez  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.

Summary: I was looking for a room that was close to work and the  'Right Price"  to spend the night.  I work during the week in Fullerton and needed a place to be able to continue to work into the evening. Great room for a "2nd office".  Nice area for an evening walk to relax and the pool was warm enough to get some exercise.  Centrally located in North Orange County with EASY access to a lot of major Freeways to get around the Los Angeles/Orange area.  This looks like I will be spending A LOT of time here.  Staff, Very helpful and It's ALWAYS nice to to come back to a clean straighten up room. I have already booked the next couple of weeks to for my Business Home away from Home.
Manager Response: We are privileged in receiving a variety of comments and suggestions. As a team, our goal is to utilize each response to map our actions to development. All responses are valued and considered a benchmark with real time and genuine support to our hotel.  This acknowledgement motivates us to keeping our Hospitality Promise we commit ourselves each day. To make it right!   Thank you and look forward to your prompt return.   Sincerely,   Christina L.  Best Western Plus Anaheim Orange County

Summary: Great hotel for the price, If they can supply the personal from the restaurant with more items for breakfast will be better. really close to Disneyland and to convenience stores, also a Denny's it next door and that helps a lot.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear from our customers.  Particularly receiving feedback on our promotional pricing. We would love to welcome you back very soon. Our breakfast hosts will receive your comments! Thank you!!! Visit our Bestwestern site and find our most current promotion to earn Reward ponts and percent discounts on our room rate.  Best regards,  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: Employees were friendly; very helpful; rooms were clean; only concern was that due to our itinerary we only got a chance to swim 2 times during our stay and the pool was closed for a few hours due to cleaning on one of those days so we missed our chance. Think this should before pool posted hours.

The room is pretty large and everything is on the low side of a 4/5 rating. It's really not bad and fairly pleasant, but on the verge of being too old. The carpet is not new and there is a strange hot tub -- essentially in the bedroom. But it is comfortable enough. The bathroom is not new.   Breakfast is as Best Western does breakfasts. I skip it.

Summary Heading: Fine hotel for access to Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Best Western Plus near Disneyland in Placentia for a 3 night stay.  The two of us found the accommodations just fine for what we needed - an affordable choice close to Disney.  The hotel itself was clean, the breakfast was portable (though they did offer made-to-order waffles), and the staff was friendly.  The hotel is right off the highway, so it was very easy to get on and off the road to get to Disney property.  The same hotel would probably cost triple closer to Disney.  The woman who was in charge of the complimentary breakfast was especially friendly.  The hotel is about a 15-20 minute ride from Disneyland.  The neighborhood looks a tad sketchy but once you're in the hotel you'd never know.  All in all, I would stay here again if looking to be

For business in Southern California I stayed at the Hotel for two weeks. The breakfast is good for a couple of days, but then it becomes tedious. The Hot tub was out of order, a disappointment. On the positive side, the room was clean, roomy, and the staff was very helpful. I will stay again.

Summary Heading: Not sure where the Plus was
Summary: This hotel was worth exactly what we paid, a special on group on.  The rooms were small and beds not so comfy.  The staff were ok.  On the "plus" side there was a free breakfast that included waffles, which the kid liked.   This is a ok stay if you dont spend much time at the hotel. One of our rooms still had the vacuum and cleaning supplies in it

Summary Heading: In an easy access location right off the 57 freeway
Summary: Arrived early afternoon.  Easy parking for hotel guests and a Denny's restaurant located right in front.  Young man at the front desk was courteous and pleasant.  Because of the room set up, it seemed a bit dark due to the separation between bedroom and living room areas.  Room seemed clean and tidy.  Bathroom was clean and large with everything you might need.  The room did smell a bit musty but quickly went away once we turned on the A/C.  There were two flat screen televisions, one in the bedroom area and one in the living room area with a great selection of channels.  King size bed was comfortable.  Breakfast was limited with omelets and your basic items.  Seating in the breakfast room was tight and there was no room to sit down, had to take the food back to our room.  One

For the price it was a good hotel.  There were five of us so we had two rooms.  They were clean.  The room was very quite, no road noise.  It was right off the 57 Freeway and close to the 91 freeway.  We did not eat the breakfast so can't comment on that.  I would rate them a little higher, but the toilet in one of our rooms became stopped up in the morning and we could not use it.  We called, but no one came before we had to leave.  Since we had two rooms we were able to use the toilet in the other room.  If not for that I would have been really upset with the slow response.  This accounts for the average rating for service.

We spent the night at this hotel rather than drive home from an Angel game.  The hotel was a reasonable distance from the stadium and in what appeared to be a quiet area.  The hotel was well equipped and clean.  Rooms on the parking lot side of the hotel may experience late night and early morning noise from guest arrival and departure.  We would stay here again, if the opportunity arose.

My boyfriend and I stayed in 3 different hotels while in CA. We went from LA to San Diego to Anaheim. While in Anaheim we stayed at the Best Western Plus. The room was clean and logically organized. There was a bathtub with jets to relax, a shower, 2 sinks, a refrigerator, and a microwave. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast food was always full, and one of the workers made the waffles for the guests. The hotel was just a couple minutes away from Disneyland and the Anaheim Angles stadium (both places that we attended).

This hotel and its staff  have always met my business travel needs professionally and efficiently. There are sometimes minor issues with internet access and wireless signal, and I have had very minor issues with electrical outlets not working, but these have never kept me from working as I need to.

This hotel is very near the Orange Freeway and access is good. There is a Denny's Restaurant at the front of the site and grabbing a quick meal is easy. The hotel is fairly basic but well maintained. There is also plenty of parking. Access to the rooms is by interior hallways. My room was clean and comfortable. Yes, would stay here again.

We stayed here on our last trip to Southern California. It was a very nice hotel and I like that it was smoke free. The price was very reasonable and they served free breakfast every morning. Toast, eggs, potatoes, oatmeal, juice, coffee, hot chocolate, cereal, fruit etc. The hotel was in a good location because we were able to get to Disneyland and Knott's Berry farm without having to get on the freeway. The lady at the counter told us how to take a different street to get there without fighting the traffic. There are also many stores, restaurants, and gas stations close by. There is a Denny's next door and they offer discounts for staying at the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Room and facilities are great, just don't expect Wake-Up Call
Summary: Asked for Morning call for 3 days in a row, never receive any call. Asked reception to check phone on 2nd day, still never receive a call. Staff seems don't care much. And, besure to ask what they do before handing out your card, especially if you arrive late at night. Staff will charge you more than it should be for deposit without even letting you know.

It was for the most part great hotel. The shower head was dirty with calcium and water marks. The breakfast spread was decent at best. They can improve the food. It is kinda hard to pull out of the hotel in the morning if you are going across traffic. But over all great experience

The on-line pricing was cheaper than when I checked in.  I didn't book on-line because I was traveling across the country and was unsure when exactly I would arrive in California.  After I checked in the amenities, fitness room and spa were not available due to remodeling.  At the price I paid I could have stayed some place else and had the amenities I enjoy using.  The staff was friendly but not anymore familiar with the area than I was.  I had inquired about a safe running area, or possibly biking, since I couldn't use the fitness center and the staff could not advise.  The breakfast was enjoyable but overly abundant with carbs and not nearly enough protein.

This way only a few miles away from Disney, very quiet, nice beds. Good breakfast with good hours. Pool was nice and clean, Jacuzzi wasn't working. The staff was very friendly. Will defiantly stay here again.

This is a very clean Best Western with comfortable beds and a lovely lobby area.  Desk Clerk provided us an early check-in at noon when we had a minor emergency and needed a place to stay. We didn't eat the breakfast as we left very early, but the room itself looked very nice.  The only disappointment would be the pool area which is a little small.  If that's not important to you, I would highly recommend this hotel in an area that doesn't offer many  options for hotels.

Summary Heading: Stay out, laundry is out of service, barely eatable breakfast
Summary: We have stay there for a once in a life time Disneyland trip on a budget and try to book this one because of the name and price, we stayed there for 5 days.  First of all the outer appearance is not very impressive, laundry is out of service, pop vendering machine went of certain kinds but never refills.  Breakfast was barely eatable.  Wired internet doesn't work at all, there was a guy trying to help but still doesn't work.   Stay out, laundry is out of service, barely eatible breakfast.  Close to nothing else except Danny.

Summary Heading: Close to all of So Cal
Summary: Very easy to access with a Denny's on the location.  Close to the 57 FWY.  Very pleased with the room quality.  Great, comfy bed.  adequate parking.  Elevator and steps.  Breakfast had fresh fruit!  Always a plus!!  Good experience and definitely will stay again.

Overall good. Too bad fitness center was out for renovations. Very convienent to all highways and attractions. Great price for the stay. Would probably stay there again. Had to a minimum if 200 characters. Hope this does it.

We stayed here three nights while visiting family in the area. The room was okay, but there was a lack of friendliness at the desk. The motel appears to be older and caters to the Disneyland crowd. The breakfast area was crowded each morning. While the place lacked charm and cozy comfort, it was convenient for our family visits. One minor irritant: The person who cleaned our room forgot a few items each day and we had to request this or that (shampoo, regular coffee, etc.) from one of the housekeepers in the hallway. My overall impression is that management was more interested in quantity of guests than quality of service. We probably would not choose to stay there again. Thumbs 3/4s down.

Summary Heading: A Gem in a busy area
Summary: Attractive inside and out. Quiet and tucked off a busy road. Surprised to find such a nice place in a semi-industrial like area.  Extra space to watch TV while not disturbing my husband who went to bed in the sleeping area before me.

The staff was very polite, and accommodations were  plentiful. The room was very clean and had the essential items needed my stay. The décor was inviting and the beds were the most comfortable beds ever. Best night sleep away from home in years. Look forward to staying again here and other locations too.

This is a nice hotel, away from the noise of the freeway. There is a Denny's  in the same parking lot as the hotel. The complimentary breakfast hosted in the breakfast room had a good variety, and the service was great.  It is only 15 minutes from Disneyland & Knotts. Angel stadium is close, as is  Fullerton College.. All freeways are easy to access. The prices are much more reasonable  than others that are near Disneyland. A good pklace to stay.

The hotel is in a good location: near freeway on/off ramps, near many popular attractions such as Angel stadium, Outlets at Orange, and Disneyland. They also have a Denny's in the front which is very convenient. However, I would not stay at this hotel again. We had a room on the second floor which is connected to the lobby by a large staircase. The people in the room next to us were partying late into the night. At about 3am, my boyfriend and I couldn't handle the noise any longer. We called the front desk and reported them (how the front desk could not hear the loud music or screams from the party-goers is beyond me as our rooms were located right at the top of the staircase). We heard them ask the people next door to soften their music, which did not happen. About an hour

Great Hotel,Courteous Service, Nice Rooms and Excellent Breakfast Selection. Easy to make reservation online. We will definitely stay again. Our Daughter is in College and works in the Fullerton Area, this was ideal location. We will definitely stay here again.

This hotel is approximately 10 minutes from Disneyland and is an excellent price.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean and the bed is relatively comfortable.  The breakfast offers a great selection including: waffles, eggs, sausage or bacon, eggs and a variety of cereal, breads and yogurt.  The staff is always available to refill the food items.  The breakfast room can get a bit crowded if the hotel is full, but there is overflow seating outside.  The hotel appears to be well insulated because there were numerous families and a large group of young people and we did not hear any noise.  We will be staying here again when we return to the Magic Kingdom.

Summary Heading: How much do you need to charge my card?
Summary: The hotel was nice.  Room was big.  Everything was clean.  I was irritated how much they charged my card.  It was 130 room and I had a 100 gift card.  Told her did not want ot put full amount on the card I had a 100 gift card.  She didn't say anything back.  I had a 230 charge on my card.  Got all but 30 of it iback which was right, but I should have known that.  I called to complain and she said that I had an ok from my signature.  Don't want to spend my life reading small print.  Will probably not stay at a best western again.

I stayed 3 nights in a standard king room and would stay here again. The neighborhood is quiet and it's close to the freeway, but far enough to not hear it. Rooms were clean and in good condition. For the price, it's a good value.

I usually stay in more expensive hotels, and I was pleasantly surprised. Room was clean, quiet and perfectly adequate.  The staff in the breakfast room were very friendly and attentive. And all this for under $70 in Anaheim!

I had a king suite and it was very spaciuos and clean.  20 minute non highway drive to Disneyland. Denny's in same parking lot.  Quiet neighborhood.  The lady that helped in the breakfast room was very helpful and tentitive. Variety of hot and cold breakfast items.

I gave this place a glowing 5-star review when we last stayed here in May 2013, but we were disappointed this time.  We visit this area because we need to assist our 89 year old mother, who lives nearby.  We were in the middle of running errands for her and hoped to check in to our hotel when we had spare time at about 1:30 PM, but were told that check in time was at 3 and no rooms were available yet.  We did a few more errands and came back at 2:45 -- still no rooms available, and several people were now waiting in the lobby.  Suddenly, at 3 o'clock on the dot, we were able to check in. It seems very unlikely to me that NO rooms were available at 2:45, but suddenly many rooms were available at 3 o'clock.  It sounded suspiciously like management policy, and not reality, and it

I enjoyed the friendly service, clean rooms and yummy breakfast.  We have family that doesn't have room for grandparents, so we stay here. Everything was as I expected and I'll stay again when visiting family in the Fullerton CA area.

Summary Heading: Claimed I smoked in room and charged me $100 extra!!!!
Summary: My family stayed at BW placentia to meet my newborn nephew. We had a great time. Beds were comfy, breakfast was decent and room was fine.  Problem came after we left and I check my acct and they had charged $100 instead of refunding my deposit! The manager Christina Lopez first said we smoked then said they found cannabis leaves in the room. I have no idea what she is talking about. They went ahead, without contacting me first- to tell me there was a problem or that they found something, and charged me. I am so upset about this. $200 down the drain because she said 'someone' saw a couple pot stems in the room somewhere. Lies and totally unethical.... I am waiting for company to resolve this. Will update my review then.

Summary Heading: Quite a decline from previous visits
Summary: I was surprised by the low rate, but learned quickly once I checked in.  The installed shower had mildew on the door and it took forever to get hot water.  The bed, pillows, internet, and shower were all fine.  The carpet needed to be shampooed.  The staff was not the friendliest either.  Previously I really raved about the hotel, but this experience was not the best.

Took a long weekend with my husband and this was our first stay here. Check in was fine and we had a room on the third floor at the end. The room was clean, quiet and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was good, plus it was great we could walk over to Denny's since we overslept a couple of times.  The only drawbacks were that there were no washcloths in the bathroom, luckily housekeeping fixed us up quickly. The other was when I went to print our boarding passes, there wasn't any paper in either printer. I had to go ask for some at the front desk and she only gave me five sheets! Otherwise, nice stay for the price.

Summary Heading: A decent priced hotel for Orange County
Summary: We stayed 3 nights while visiting our daughter.  The place was clean as well as our room.  A nice selection for breakfast with fruit, bacon, eggs, cereal and huge waffles!  Our disappointment was the bathtub was plugging up and the hot tub did something to our swimsuits and skin.  We turned green!  Was itchy for a few days afterward even after showering.  Not sure what was in the hot tub??  The price of the room was very good.  I would recommend this place especially for families who are going to the theme parks and beaches.  I might stay here again because of the price.

Summary Heading: Great Clean Place and Good Value
Summary: This hotel was very nice with clean rooms and common area.  The room sizes were a good size.  The staff was very friendly.  This hotel is in a great location as it is very close to Disneyland and other Anaheim area attractions.

The Bed springs felt as they were broken and dilapidated. . Bed felt like sleeping on a mattress that was older than me.  The place was clean and cheap, but the back pain and restless sleep was not work the financial savings.

Comfortable bed, great internet, but the dishes of cigarette butts on the tables in front of the hotel are DISGUSTING!!!  The hotel uses demand pricing, so you don't get the same rate every time for the same room. Also, some of the room on the second floor have exterior lights that shine into the room at night. Always ask for a third floor room at the ends of the building.

We visited family for 5 days in the area and booked this hotel in advance.  We moved after 3 days for more comfortable accommodations.  The breakfast area was overcrowded, but outdoor tables were welcoming.  This handicapped accessible room was outfitted with a king bed which we found too soft.  The pillows were very bulky, so I used one from our car instead.  Staff was friendly, but communication was not always easy. I ended up taking breakfast to the room for my husband who is wheelchair bound.

I have stayed at this hotel twice a month for nearly 15 years. I only stay there for it's proximity to my business. The hotel and the value are decent. The management there, is horrible. I was in an automobile accident and was unable to cancel a reservation and they charged me full price anyway, even though they are rarely if ever sold out. That's the thanks I get for 15 years of patronage...Sad and greedy!!

Great location to Disneyland & So Cal entertainment!  Friendly staff.  Clean and well kept.   Close to 57 Fwy.  Denny's by  hotel.  Will stay there again.  Very pleased with stay.   We had friends come there to visit and they were also impressed.  Elevator or stairs to 2-3 floors.  Impressive lobby.

excellent place.The room was FANTASTIC. Excellent bed, amazing tv, wonderful bathroom, coupled with an extra chair, coffee machine, and desk. Incredible. The breakfast in the morning was also great. The staff were warm and friendly. The facility was spotless.

I enjoyed my stay for the most part.The check in went well and the room was very nice.My only complaint was the bathroom sink had hair in it and toothpaste spatter on the faucet.Other than that I enjoyed the room and my meal from Denny's which is right out front. In the morning the breakfast was adequate.Right before checking out, I went to the business center to print a couple of important documents which I needed for later.Both the printers were out of ink and there was 3 pieces of paper between the two of them.That's not acceptable to me and the front desk people offered no help.

On a short notice comming from Universal Studios I booked at this hotel.  Upon arrival their staff was extremly friendly.  Room was was okay, but could hear the showers from everyone else. The best expierence was the breakfast!  My family and myself was treated as if we were at home.  The staff treated us as their own.  I wanted to thank them and look forward to going back again.

The hotel was super nice, but in a very industrial area. Not much around it. (Tom's Place was a great eat though). However, booked this through priceline (Specific bed choice) and when arrived, the wrong room was booked. Had to pay for an extra room the first 2 nights. The last 6 nights we were given correct room but had to pay $35/night upgrade fee. So we ended up between those charges paying DOUBLE for what we originally paid. The hotel put a double hold on our card as well. We now had hardly any money left for our spending for our vacation.  When we approached the hotel about all of these, everything was Priceline or "our bank's" fault. I would have believed it except the last morning 3 guests in front of me also complained about charges on their cards.  Finally, at checkout

Great staff and rooms for the price, Great location, nice breakfast , will certainly stay there again and again. Look forward to it. All were very helpful including the manager Thanks Again for the great customer care and concern shown

Great staff and nice, clean and comfortable rooms.  Spent 3 nights and really enjoyed it.  Only draw back was the powdered eggs at breakfast.  The lady in the breakfast room went above and beyond in helping with breakfast however. Staff was very helpful at all times.

I and my family went to the Disneyland Resort for two days and we stayed at the Best Western Plus Anaheim Orange County Hotel for two nights.  We thought that being rated a 3 star Best Western Plus and with the good reviews that we would have a really great stay.  But, the carpet in our room was so dirty that we did not take off our socks the whole time we had to walk on the carpet.  The bottom of my white socks were totally blackened.  I'm not kidding!  Also, the hall carpet looked as dirty as the carpet in our room. There was stuff on the carpet that we passed by in the hall that was never vacuumed up.  You may ask why we stayed in the same room for 2 nights when the carpet was so bad.  Well, the room was paid for in advance and also, when we got back to the room after a long

I would say that if you want to stay in a hotel that's convenient, this would be the one.  It's not too far from anything really.  A short freeway ride from here and there.  We really like this hotel, the night staff are really GREAT and AWESOME.    But they do not have any housekeeping in the evening and you would have to pick up your own supplies that you need from the front desk.   Only complaint about the room is that the beds are a bit lumpy and TOO HIGH. It's as if you would to get a running start before you can get on it.    The staff in the evening, as I've said, are really great.  But the day staff, not so much.  The front desk clerks are never helpful about anything.  I asked for some water and she said there's a fountain in the workout room and turned around and

We were treated with respect and our requests were met.  Very clean and quiet hotel.  Very comfortable.  Beautifully decorated.  Excellent food.  When we go back we would prefer to stay in this hotel because we felt safe and comfortable there.

Both mattresses in the double Queen room were not great.  They tilted to the outsides.  The pillows were newer but were so thick I could not sleep with one.  I requested a thinner pillow but they said they were all the same.  The room itself was clean but the hall and stair carpets were stained.  Hotel was close to freeways and convenient to get where we needed to go.  Staff was always friendly.  Staff in breakfast area were there to please.  Breakfast was nice.  Pool was heated perfectly.  Even though the bed was not the best, I would still recommend staying here.

Summary: This is a great place to stay once I stayed here about 3 years ago I have continued to stay here no reason to look for another hotel. The staff is great the rooms are great A+++++++ all the way. It is close to to everything you could need, stores,food down town ect.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your stay with us. Guest satisfaction is important to us and we try our best to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding experience at our hotel.  As our success is measured by how our guests evaluate our services and facilities, we want you to know that our pricing is the start on this partnership.   We look forward to your upcoming stay.   Sincerely,  Christina L.  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: The quality of the hotel is good but we were asked for a $100 credit card damage deposit which is unusual. When I asked for the credit card voucher the next morning they said no -- that  someone would check the room for damages and the that if none the manager would tear ti up the next day which I said was not reasonable. They then informed me that a credit card imprint was not taken. When I asked for a copy of the form that I signed from the previous evening that they could not do that. I said I would comment on Trip Advisor and left.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your feedback on TripAdvisor!  Our computer system has been upgraded and we no longer process vouchers for incidentals. Fortunately, our system will require a credit card to be swiped instead of an imprint.  Foreing credit cards and identifications may still be of use with a Credit Card Authorization form.  We appreciate your cooperation and understanding.   Looking forward to your next arrival,   Sincerely,   Christina L.  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary Heading: Excellent base for Los Angeles stay
Summary: My wife and I spent 13 nights here as part of a 3 week South-West holiday. We like to stay in one place and drive around, as opposed to keep moving hotels. This hotel, right next to the 57 and 91 freeways, serves as an excellent base for the Los Angeles area if you don't mind up to a 90 minute drive to get to some places. It took us this long to drive up to the attractions around Hollywood.  The hotel is easy to find and has loads of parking. Check-in was efficient and the staff were friendly throughout our stay and answered all questions promptly and with courtesy, including daily requests to access the safe deposit box at reception.   We were impressed with the room; it was in fact a mini-suite with separate lounge area with sofa, and kitchen area with sink, fridge and
Manager Response: In Orange County and LA County, we welcome you and work hard to make your stay a delightfully experience. We strive to make sure each and every guest has an enjoyable stay with us. We are looking forward to seeing you again soon!   Sincerely,   Christina L. Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: Hotel is clean with inviting lobby. Room good size...quiet...big screen TV. Parking plentiful and free. Breakfast plentiful and hot and cold items...waffles freshly made. Staff courteous and friendly. Got a good price on hotwire...close to Nixon Library..my reason for traveling. Would recommend and gladly stay again. Thanks Best Western!
Manager Response: Dear pagegirl507:   Thank you for your participation. Our partnership with third party sites are always an advantage to our guests. We will do our best to accommodate your special requests. Please visit us again soon, Knott's Theme Park, Disney and many other attractions are just minutes away.   See you soon!   Sincerely  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: Easy access to 91 or 57 fwy, comfortable rooms, conveniently appointed. Comfortable, clean, without children running amok. Nice warm breakfast selections. Do not have to walk thorough Cigarette smoke to get to your room or lobby area. Business center available to use to print, or access your emails, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to participate with your opinion. We look forward to welcome you soon and invite you to contact us to make reservations.  Our heated pool, on site restaurant and ample free parking are some of the reasons to take an trip to Disney.  Thank you and look forward to welcoming you soon.   Sincerely  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: I am a frequent business traveler and frequent reviewer and to be honest, not easily pleased. This little gem of a hotel  is located conveniently off of a major hiway but near a lower middle class neighborhood and in back of a Dennys to a little hard to spot. The lobby is well done, the staff is accommodating, and the rooms are both large and well appointed. The breakfast the next day was as you have come to expect but the area was clean and the food well prepared. My only complaint and I know I am among millions in this regard is the slow internet. Those of us who travel for a living count on it and this one was too slow to be useful.  It was a great little hotel and the experince was at the top levle of a budget priced property.

Summary: The Hotel was clean,  Close to Disneyland, nice staff, comfortable bed, good price, and has free breakfast.  I would recommend to anyone and would for sure stay again if we were going to Disneyland or anything in that area.
Manager Response: Hello Heidi!  Families and groups really enjoy our location when visiting Disneyland. Our goal is to exceed your expectations with accessible pricing; more importantly with your satisfaction in our services and amenities . Our guests enjoy of a free breakfast, free parking and Wi-Fi access.Your participation on this portal is key information for others visiting our location.   Thank you and see you very soon!  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: The Best Western on Orangethorpe was a nice hotel, and we got it for a great price.  They had a full breakfast (though the website says "continental") and a heated pool.  The rooms were nice and clean.  Overall, a nice hotel, and only about 10 minutes from Disneyland via the 57.  Would recommend.  The only negative was the fitness room.  The treadmill was not usable for running, and the bike didn't work.  The other machines worked.
Manager Response: Thank you Kelly from Flagstaff!   We are delighted with you review. Our breakfast host is constantly working on serving new items, making the breakfast experience a PLUS for our guests. As your mentioned, our location is close to Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm and many other attractions, beaches and more... we look forward to your next visit.   Thank you for your letting us know about the gym and your recommendations, our operations manager is currently working on equipment options.  Once again, thank you!  Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: I was very please with this hotel, the staff and especially my room. The only problem I had was the hot water took about 5 minutes to heat up.  I learned this after the first night. Thank you for all the help.

Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel

Summary: Since our last stay they have completed the replacement of the exterior windows. Summary Heading: I LOVE this hotel! Go ahead and book...you'll agree!
Summary: Second time staying here this year while on Disney vacation. The staff is always courteous, the rooms are very clean, it's quiet so sleeping comes easily. We had a double-queen room and it had a sofa bed on it. Talk about comfort! Our family of five fit perfectly without the squished feeling we usually have in rooms designed to fit 4. The decor is attractive. Location is relatively close to Disney. Will be back!

Summary: I am really confused how this Hotel has such good ratings on this website.  I booked through Travelocity and had saw that it had some bad reviews but after visiting trip advisor and seeing the good reviews I booked it. WORST IDEA ever. Worst service experience that I have ever had, front desk staff was rude and we were given the wrong room 3 times. We were lied to and told they didn't offer the room we booked but then after "getting" approval and attitude for 30 min she finally gave us the room that 30 min prior didn't exist.  We were up 3-4 times both nights because you could hear ever movement from the upstairs neighbors, from tossing and turning to walking and everything in between including their bathroom visits... yeah. DISGUSTING.  The room was very dated and dirty.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in So Cal
Summary: Even though it is near a freeway and major road, the hotel is quiet.  Staff are helpful.  Breakfast was good, with the usual fare plus excellent scrambled eggs and sausage.  The bed had four pillows, which I loved, and was very comfortable.  Plenty of parking, and well lit.  Room was clean.  Great value for the price.

Summary: very helpful and courteous staff members. Excellent beds and breakfast. Warm breakfast not the normal continental like other hotels. Will defenitly return and recommend. Rooms look like they have been recently upgraded.

Summary: Hotel was very clean and the rooms were very comfortable.  The lady who helped with breakfast was very helpful and the pool and jacuzzi were nice and warm on a cool morning. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for a low rate
Summary: This is a good value for the price. My room was clean and comfortable and the registration and check-out process were fast and easy. This Best Western has indoor hallways and elevator access to the upper floors. The free breakfast is passable. There is a Denny's Diner (icoffee shop) located adjacent to the hotel and grabbing an evening meal is easy. The Orange 55 Freeway is being widened and getting here can be a problem during the rush hours. If you need to make a flight at the airport, give yourself a few extra minutes.

Summary Heading: A good value for the money
Summary: The room was clean and comfortable. The room, however, lacked a microwave as was advertised. The staff was excellent, but the breakfast was nothing special and did not have oatmeal. The orange juice was very weak...mostly water.

My overall stay at this location was great I stay here about once a month and have never had a problem.There is a Denny's on sight with a discount. The pool and spa area is clean. It is close to  Angles Statuim, The Honda Center, Disneyland, And Knots Berry Farm.

My family visits Southern California often and we have stayed at several of the "Good Neighbor" hotels that are surrounding Disney. Most of those hotels charge fees for parking and say they are within walking distance however, the walks have always been a bit distant and slightly difficult for children especially after a long day in the park. Therefore, this year we decided to go a little further out and we found this hotel. We are glad we did.   What we saved on hotel rates and hotel parking fees made up for the slight drive and parking fees at Disney.  Once in the Disney area we replaced our long walk from the hotel with a short walk through the Disney parking let to the shuttle.  At the end of our day in the park we were very thankful for the shorter walk with our daughter

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a total of 6 nights. Five nights in one room and 1 night in another. The good part of this stay was the ladies in the breakfast buffet and the housekeeping team. They did a great job. In our first room on the 3rd floor, we had good beds and the TV worked. However, the curtain to keep the room dark was broken and would not shut all the way (3 sets of curtains - one that is to keep light out, a light curtain and then decorative curtains). There was also a light right outside the window as we were right above the front entrance. This light was on all night. We told the front desk and nothing was done and we couldn't change rooms because they didn't have anything available. In this same room, we did not have any cold water at the faucets. It was warm to

Other than the carpet being dirty and worn, the room was clean. The staff was helpful and pleasant. Would definitely stay there again.  Good bargain and nice hot breakfasts.  There is a Denny's right next door.  Easy access to 57 freeway with a Chevron station right at the freeway entrance.

Nice big clean rooms. The beds were so comfortable we slept like babies. There was a massive jet spa tub for two, a couch with a table and a desk and chair. The carpets were clean. The check in staff were friendly and helpful.

Exterior and Interior clean and spacious. Check in quick and easy.  Only con was that Rooms available only had a king size bed. we came as a group and all rooms only had 1 bed available.  other than that everything else was great.  Great breakfast.

Summary Heading: What I expected for Best Western
Summary: Large room, jetted tub, comfy bed.  Basic breakfast, not anything I would eat, but convenient enough if you have a large family.  Easy check in/out.  Stayed at a competing hotel weekend prior, and needed a break from terrible beds, smelly and hot hallway (extended stay) and part time residents (definitely got what I payed for there).

If you're looking for a place to sleep. get a cheap breakfast to fill your kids bellies; this is the hotel. For a business traveler I would not recommend if you plan to do any work in your room. Outside of the very comfortable bed, the stay was uninspiring. Cheap décor, not the upgraded that's shown on the website for BW Plus hotels. I slept well but otherwise I'd advise to go somewhere else.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to sleep before Disneyland
Summary: We needed a place to stay for the night prior to going to Disneyland. We found the perfect place. It's 15 minutes away from there for 2 to 4 times less expensive than being on the site. It even included a good breakfast. The room was clean and comfortable.

We were very happy with our stay, it had clean rooms, bed was comfortable, and  Breakfast was good and very convenient. We had a family get together in that area, and it was very well located, to things that we wanted to see and do.  I would recommend this hotel.

We are diamond on the rewards program which means we stay at least 30 times per year. Platinum & Diamond reward customers are supposed to be given the option of a snack or points at check in.This was not even mentioned by front desk, when I pointed it out the young man seemed to get an attitude. Upon opening the door to our room the smell of smoke greeted us.This is an all non smoking hotel. When I went back downstairs to advise the desk and change rooms, Mr.Attitude said well now your going to be on the 3rd floor! (I really don't care which floor I'm on as long as I don't have to smell smoke.) The next morning taking a shower the water did not drain fast enough so we were standing in ankle deep dirty water.Check out was time consuming as there is a $100.00 deposit due at check

Summary Heading: Clean, Family had everything you needed
Summary: WE had to moved from the original hotel we staying in due to the condition of the overall hotel.  Last minute trying to locate a 2 room for my family just to get out, BW was great and really worked with me, was able to find a hotel close to where we were and it was great.  Clean, Friendly, had everything we needed.  Walking in gave us a good idea what to expect over all and the rooms did just that.  From now on will always work with BW first when looking for room.   The price was great since I was paying more at the 1st hotel which was noted as a high end hotel and charged more.  Individual who checked us in had a relative in the Air Force,  my husband and I are both retired AF, so it was nice.  Friendly staff always willing and waiting to help.  About 15-20 minutes from

Hotel was not in a nice area. Mostly industrial. Very busy hotel with youth group. Breakfast mediocre and breakfast room very crowded and noisy. Front desk employees not very helpful. When we checked in the front desk clerk didn't say anything to us about breakfast.

Summary Heading: BEST WESTERN PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel
Summary: Location of hotel was not what I expected it was in the middle of nowhere surrounded by apartments. The reservations I made did not match the room that I was given, but the staff made accommodations and provided an uncomfortable roll-away bed and microwave. Also, the hotel is about a 15 minute drive from Disneyland. Overall breakfast items were OK cereal was bland and juices were watered down. They provided a variety of breakfast items like eggs, waffles, sausages, biscuits and gravy, yogurt, and bagels.

We chose this hotel in part because of other TripAdvisor reviews. We had a 2 Queen room and stayed for a week.  The room was very spacious, included a couch, coffee table,desk, frig and micro.  Bathroom also spacious.  Excellent location for Orange County attractions.  Room was clean and quiet.  Breakfasts were very good with eggs,etc. plus 2 attendants making waffles.  We didn't have any but they looked fluffy and light.  Also had a bowl of fruit which most hotels do not have.  Now the negative.  Because the hotel was fully booked each night the breakfast room was very crowded.  Suggest going at 7 am which we did.  Housekeeping was very poor.  No consistency.  One day we had 6 bath towels, no hand towels.  Another, no washcloths. Rarely were the shampoo, etc. replaced.  Since

Summary Heading: Handy location, near Disney, easy drive to/from LAX
Summary: We only stayed one night, just before next-morning flight from LAX. This was so economical compared to hotels near airport.  Service was fine at check-in. Room was everything we needed. A minor complaint about the pillow top mattresses, probably felt uncomfortable since we're not accustomed to them. Slept like a baby, tho, once I got situated.   TV worked fine. Did not use the pool. The vending machines for drinks were nearly empty, not a water bottle in sight.   The location is a quiet residential area. Out the window, I could see a public park in easy walking distance with playground, basketball, etc. families with kids might appreciate walking there. Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights while visiting disneyland. We are hotel professionals ourselves and often times stay in hotels. This one was above average, but would need some improvements. Pros: complimentary parking, breakfast, Internet, overall quality of amenities, size of the rooms. Cons: Overworked staff, too noisy door banging, cheeply done renovations/finishes (wallpaper, tiling, bathroom) all looked a bit substandard, esspecially when inspected closer. Breakfast was all fried food. not many healthy options. still great rate for a 3 star in the area. Advise: provide shuttle to disney for your guests :)!

The overall of the hotel was average. The floors and carpet throughout the hotel and bathrooms could have been a lot cleaner. Also, everytime we left the hotel and came back our room keys did not work!

We stayed there for two nights. We found the staff to be very friendly and welcoming. The room we stayed at was very convenient and clean however slightly old. They allow you to access a kitchen at any time which is advantage for families with kids like us. Location wise it’s not the best hotel to stay at if you like to walk however if you’re willing to drive it shouldn't be an issue. Generally it’s a good hotel and I’d recommend it for family stays.

The bed was fantastic, except for the hard pillows.  We definitely want to find which Beautyrest mattress this is, but the staff was not sure.  The pillows were definitely too hard for us and we should of asked for softer ones. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast was just what we needed to start our day.  Great friendly, helpful staff.

We spent three days at this hotel.  The front desk person (I think his name was Michael) was very pleasant at check in. We had a question about using reward points and Michael didnt know the answer to our question, but we discovered the next morning that he had followed up and taken care of it.  We appreciated his follow through.  Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.    We used the guest laundry while there and discovered that the washer had left some spots on our whites.  I spoke with Perla at the front desk.  She was very pleasant and had us speak with the manager.  The manager offered to have our things washed by her staff and everything came out without the spots.  At another time I was having trouble with the printer and Michael came to my aid.  We have

We stayed here for five nights in order to help an elderly relative settle into a senior citizens' apartment complex nearby.  Really can't say enough about the cleanliness of the room, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, and the great breakfast buffet.  Since we were staying for a relatively long time, we were given a third floor room at the end of the hallway, with a view out to a very nice park.  Totally relaxing, and a good location for the Disney parks as well.

After a long day at the musuem - we needed to rest. This hotel had easy access from the 57 North Freeway. Check in was a breeze. There was a Denny's right next to the hotel however, we were so tired - we stayed in and ate what we had in our ice chest. The only downfall to this is that there wasn't a microwave in the room but, there was a frige. The hotel's breakfast was very good as was there service. I will definately keep this hotel in mind for our next trip.

Stayed about 5 days from Sunday to Friday night. I like the layout of our room that has a 1/2 dividing wall that separates the bedroom from the living area. The bedroom and the living room each have their own flat screens. Room has a small refrigerator, a microwave and single serve coffee maker. The work desk is of good size even though it shares it with the flat screen. It's quiet even though its about 2 blocks from freeway. A Denny's restaurant is next door and Tom's Place fast food is across Orangethorpe.  A Enterprise car rental is about 1-2 blocks East of the hotel.

This is a great hotel to stay at if you are visiting Disneyland.  They offer clean, comfortable rooms and great customer service whether you are checking in, out or going to the free hot breakfast.  The woman who works in the breakfast room is very efficient and very gracious while keeping everything hot, picked up and re-stocked.  For the price, this is one of the best deals for a Disney hotel.  The drive is a quick 7 minute commute on uncrowded roads.  They also have a Denny's on property and a few drive thru's close by.  The only reason for the 4 star for sleep comfort is due to the height of the new beds and the difficulty getting my handicapped son on the bed.

In the L.A. area for Spring Break to watch our daughter compete in 2 college track meets.  We only stayed here for 3 nights for the first track meet, and were very happy with our choice of hotel. Room and bathroom were clean, beds comfortable, fridge and microwave very handy. The hotel has plenty of parking and was conveniently located for Disneyland, Fullerton Arboretum and the Nixon library.  Breakfast was more than adequate - scrambled eggs or mini cheese omelets, some kind of bacon, sausage or sausage hash, make-your-own-waffles, fresh fruit, bakery items, toast, bagels, cold cereals, juices and milk......  The breakfast staff were delightful, always smiling and very helpful.  Nice hotel, nice staff, great rates; would definitely stay again.

It is a very good velue/report no bad surprise always the same good quality in every aspects. don't know where to go play it safe use this hotel. Hotel is situated right buy a Dennis so very convenient for late lunch or early/late breakfeast

I was welcomed when I walked in.  The rooms I had reserved where ready and clean and well equipped.  The staff was friendly and the breakfast in the morning was very nice.  I will stay here again!!!!!!!!!!

Climbing into bed was difficult...the mattress kept moving off the box spring...mattress might need to be changed.  It was very soft.  Breakfast was first rate. Quiet, even though it was close to freeway.

We stayed here one night after a late flight. The clerk was very friendly and check-in was fast. The room had 2 beds plus a fold out couch which was a nice surprise. Pretty roomy overall and beds were average.   Thin walls though and the people next to us were also overly loud with an infant. The baby cried off and on but it was the adults that were the most annoying occasionally yelling at each other well into the 4am hour, so that was unpleasant but not the fault of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Amazing value, free internet, breakfast and more
Summary: I found out last minute that I had to go to Anaheim for a major trade show. All of the local hotels were booked but the presenters had a few listed with availabilities a 10-15 minutes away.  I checked them out on the internet and although I'm accustomed to higher end brands, the special internet rate of $82.00 a night for a King Room with 42inch TV, free breakfast, parking, internet, pool and gym got my attention.   And yes it wasn't the Ritz Carlton, and it was 10 minutes away, but it was more than I expected and actually perfect! No room service but a refrigerator in the room and 30 second walk to Denny's.Plus a nice staff, clean room and comfy bed. Also a great place to stay cheap if you're bringing the kids to Disneyland.

My family stayed here for 12 days in middle of August. Good price and only 12 minute drive to Disney. Great place to stay if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle:) rooms were great, breakfast was great. People complain about such petty things! This hotel was is a great place to stay!

This hotel is tucked away behind a Denny's restaurant about four blocks away from the on ramps to CA 57 and close to I-5 as well.  We were in Los Angeles for the 2013 Rose Parade and related events.  LA is so spread out that few places in the region are really convenient.  But this location served our needs pretty well.  Close to Disney and Knott's Berry Farm.  The hotel was better than I expected.  It was clean.  The bed was comfortable.  The shower was clean.  Plenty of hot water.  The climate controls were easy to use and the fan did not keep everyone awake -- as seems to be the norm with some modestly priced hotels in tourist alley.  Our room had two living areas, each with its own tv and separated by a wall.  With many budget-oriented hotels moving toward two-room suites,

Summary Heading: A Nice Change From The Hectic Disneyland Motels
Summary: My daughter and her friend stayed here for 2 nights the first week of January. It was a short notice trip and Anaheim was busy so we had to find an alternate motel from our usual choices. After some research, she decided on this one. I was a bit apprehensive not knowing the neighborhood but she said it was a nice, decent neighborhood and she felt totally safe at all times. Motel is just off the freeway but, not close enough to have the noise. Check in was easy and smooth. Room was nice, clean, nothing worth commenting on. She said the beds were super comfy. Free breakfast was good, not great, but certainly better than most other "free" breakfasts offered by other motels. She also said that it was really nice to be away from the noise and hectic pace of Disneyland. The drive is

We wanted to book something very near to Disney resort but since we booked only a week ahead we took this Best Western closest available to the resort. We stayed here for 4 nights .Not very close to Disney resort, located within 5 miles, not too far away either. Like other reviewers say, carpets look dull, breakfast menu and sticky waffles are noticeable. But they have great staff. Yes, lady working in the breakfast area was very helpful and friendly. But it was obvious sight to watch her and another staff work on the waffle maker, spraying, fighting to get the waffles out in a single piece. The waffle maker needs to be booted and money spent on oil spray could be a good investment towards new and better Waffle maker. We never liked the only variety of bread they served and only

The hotel is conveniently located off Interstate 57.  The hotel staff was very accomodating. The room was spacious with an excellent desk space to spread out and work. The bed was also extremely comfortable.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: My family and I are in town and staying at this hotel now for 12 days in a row.  As we have already payed for our stay (had this trip booked since June for a Christmas present to our kids) its too late to change hotels.  The rooms are clean, staff friendly, if you speak spanish, otherwise they're no help.  Fitness and laundry room clean, only one washer working.  Weather permitting the pool and jacuzzi are syill open even in December, so thats nice.  Rooms good size, have huge TV although the remote control is extremely annoying to get to work.  We have a fridge and microwave which is nice to store our travel snacks/drinks and reheat leftovers from nearby restaurants.  Not too far to travel to the theme parks, but they are doing some kind of construction on Orangethorpe in front

Summary: This hotel is very conveniently located, right in the center of lots of attractions and just blocks off I-5, giving easy access to much of California.  Delightful people serve the facility.  Clean; delicious breakfast included in cost or room.

Spent 4 nights here in August at the start of our holiday. Room was comfy although could do with more seating, but was clean and quiet. Pool was good and not used much. Good discount in Dennys adjacent. Fab breakfast, although needs to have bacon more often, English visitors are not used to biscuits and gravy for breakfast!! Wifi worked well.

My family and I stayed here for 3 nights and we were very happy overall with this Best Western Plus. Our trip was mainly to go see Newport Beach (15-20 min drive) and Disneyland (10 min drive) and getting to/from those areas was super easy. The hotel is located about 1 mile from CA-57 (Orangethorpe exit) and there is a Denny's restaurant right out front. The hotel has 3 floors, we had a room on 3rd floor looking west (not much of a view, but very quiet). Free Parking and Free Breakfast every day was a nice added bonus! Parking lot was well lit, plenty of spaces, and very well kept. Breakfast was nice, good variety, but nothing out of the ordinary. There was hot waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage gravy/biscuits, yogurt, bagels, toast, milk, juices,coffee, cereals and some fresh fruit.

The hotel is beautiful, very clean, nicely furnished. Unfortunately, I had to leave unexpectantly early for a meeting and left my ipad 3 in my luggage. I had a flight that evening so, I asked the hotel front desk clerk to lock my luggage up but; they just left it behind the counter. My IPAD 3 was stollen. When I returned after my meeting, my IPAD was not in my luggage. The gal behind the front desk did not seem surprised or concerned. The Hotel Manager left me a return message a couple weeks later saying that they checked the cameras and did not see anything. Very questionable! Be careful, they where not concerned about my loss.

There were three of us so I figured they would give us two queen size beds.  When we arrived at the hotel, there was a man complaining about having booked a room on hotwire and how there was three of them, why would they want one king size bed. I would definitely come back to this hotel on my next Disney vacation. Thanks
