Summary Heading: Nice room at a reasonable price
Summary: My hotel choices aren't necessarily based upon how many stars it has. When the hotel is for basically sleeping and I'm going to be elsewhere throughout the day, I'm not necessarily looking for a whole lot of amenities. My primary criteria:  is the room clean.   It doesn't have to be spotless but it needs to be fairly clean.  Best Westerns can vary from good to a few I'd probably skip. This one was great.  I went down for my niece's graduation and we stayed overnight here.  The room had two queens and there were four adults and it was fine. I would say just a little crowded but we were just staying over one night so not a lot of luggage between all of us though we also had 3 laptops.  Wifi reception was fine. They had it protected but the password was provided on the desk in the

trash in the room when we checked in, no microwave in the room, internet connection is poor, and the pool was closed. When we complained, their response was "well we can give you a microwave for an extra $10 a day". Otherwise, looks like a nice place, maybe others have had a better experience.

Summary Heading: Excellent, clean, comfortable and well appointed
Summary: Wow!  I read some of the other reviews and wonder if it's the same place I stayed in.  I was there alone and only for one night, but I was in the room half of the afternoon, the entire evening, and early the next morning.  I found the bed extremely comfortable, the internet pretty good (I couldn't get the data port to work so I used their wireless), and the room was clean - very clean.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I was upgraded to a room with a whirlpool bath, which was nice until I saw the small shower.  Next time, I'll ask for a standard king.  My window looked right onto the lobby parking area, which was a little freaky, so I closed by sheer blinds and felt better.  I did not eat breakfast this time, but on previous occasions I found it great.  I will stay there

Summary: We went here on a family vacation, we were visiting all of the local theme parks. The positives are the bed was comfortable after a long day. The parking,breakfast,and internet were all free. The hotel was also close to the parks so that was very convenient. It was not the worst place in the world but not as nice as some of the reviews lead you to believe. The carpet in the room was dirty and the room smelled badly. Even the carpet in the lobby and stairs were not clean. My major gripes were not enough towels for all of the people in my room. Some days instead of giving enough towels they gave face towels. They ask you not to take your room towels to the pool because they are provided, but they were all dirty so my kids had to shiver wet and cold back to our room. While there

Summary: Stayed here a week with my family and another family and overall had a great experience.  We knew going in that the hotel was away from the parks which is exactly what we wanted.  The Disney hotel area was super expensive over the 4th of July weekend and the value for what you get at BW Placentia was much better.  If your looking for that "Disney Hotel" experience that don't stay here.  If your looking for a great value away from the hustle and bustle of the parks than this is a great choice.  Hotel location is one block off the 57 and 91 freeways so getting to all the parks is super easy.  About 15 minutes to Knott's and 12 to Disney.  Anaheim stadium and Honda center are both about 5 minutes away.  Beaches are about 25-30 minutes which isn't much closer than Disney area
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment about the Best Western PLUS Anaheim Orange County Hotel.   We are delighted to learn you had a memorable stay with us.  With your paticipation our guest receive the opportunity to learn about our amenities and services as an option when visiting the Anaheim/Fullerton area.    If you are coming back to the area, please contact us so we are honored in hosting you soon.  Once again, Thank you for your preference!   Sincerely,   Christina L.  Best Western PLUS Anahiem Orange County Hotel.

Summary: My family and I booked a 4 night stay to mainly visit all the local theme parks; thank goodness that our entire days were spent at the parks and ultimately only needed the facility to rest our heads at night. The room we occupied was on the lower level across from the breakfast room…although that was a convenience, it didn’t make up for the fact the walls are SUPER SUPER THIN which allowed us to hear every conversation, word for word, from the guests next door and all the noise from the outside hall. Also, couldn’t understand the humidity in the room as we kept the air running our entire stay, it literally felt like we were walking on wet carpet and what a horrible sewer-like smell coming from the closet.  Seriously, way too many cons to list. Please do not be fooled by photos

The check in process went rather smoothly, the facility was clean and the beds and pillows were amazing.  We were visiting Disneyland and it was a few minutes drive away but not bad.  I appreciated the fact that housekeeping did not turn down our air while we were gone, it was nice coming into a cold room at the end of the day.  The bad isn't good. Whirlpool did not work and front desk gentleman was nice & said we can move you or charge you for standard room since the whirlpool is broken. We're supposed to be there 3 nights but since location was horrible across the street from trailer home park we had decided to move. Summary Heading: Excellent Stay, 4 Star, Affordable, Close to Everything.
Summary: We originally were going to stay at BW Burbank, but decided to stay near Disneyland.  After researching hotels near the park in Anaheim, the accomodations were outrageously expensive, and not so nice.  We decided on Best Western Plus in Placienta.  The check-in process was fast, the room was extremely nice, newly renovated.  42" Flat Screen, Coffee Maker with free Coffee, Refrigerator, and the Bed was very comfortable.  The housekeepers were extremely nice, and made our stay peaceful.  We had no issues, other than the WIFI didn't allow us to upload pictures to Twitter or Facebook.  The pool was extremely nice, warm, and Hot Tub perfect.  Breakfast was nice except for the eggs, a little runny, but the bisuits and gravy, AMAZING.  A very affordable stay.  We took advantage of the

I've stayed at this hotel several times in the last couple of years. The stay has always been pleasant and enjoyable. I probably will continue to return to this hotel whenever I need to be in the Anaheim, Fullerton area, which seems to occur frequently. While this hotel is not actually near anything (other than the Denny's Restaurant at the front of the property), if you have your own car, most things are available within a very few miles including good shopping, good restaurants, recreation, Major League Baseball and Hockey, Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, a major University (Cal State Fullerton), and for all you computer geeks, Fry's Electronics.   The Hotel is clean and quiet, has great people at the front desk, very comfortable beds, and some, if not all rooms have two

We stayed 4 nights at the BW. The room was clean and big, the bed is very comfortable, we liked the breakfast, easy access to the freeways. The only problem with this hotel is the key to the room. The magnet does not work, and we had to go down to the Reception area many times to get the key reprogrammed.

Summary Heading: Things to know before you stay...
Summary: The good news is the room was clean, staff were friendly.    What prompts me to write this review is to warn about 3 things:  1.  WiFi access was not just slow but it cuts you off if you visit FaceBook or MySpace.  This was a major pain.  Not an issue if you don't need to use the internet much. 2.  v.1.0 Low-Flush toilets in the rooms that are prone to clog up with normal use.  Not an issue if you don't need to use the toilet during your stay. 3. Outdoor pool was beautiful and clean but UNHEATED.  Jacuzzi was nice.  Not an issue if you are staying during the summer.

I was in California for a pleasure/business trip. My son and I stayed at this hotel and found the accommodations fulfilled our expectations. When dealing with an issue that came up management dealt with it promptly, professionally and satisfactorily.  I felt I received great value for the money.  The breakfast is not of a high standard but there is a Denny's attached to the building.

Visiting Disneyland for the day with the family.  We found the hotel to be delightfully furnished. The guestrooms were exceptionally clean. The beds were so comfortable and the rooms so quite it was hard to get up and going in the morning. Enjoyed visiting with the front desk staff the night of arrival. He was cheerful and  accommodating. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast in a beautiful morning room. Breakfast was a little light on the offering but ample and delicious. Especially the blueberry make-your-own waffles! Great business center in the lobby.  The women enjoyed the exercise room in the morning!  Why exercise before Disneyland I will never know?  We would highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is well located, especially if you are planning to visit Disney parks. There are many good restaurants in the area and it's easy to get to LA and Hollywood (Universal studio, etc.). Two points for improvement: 1. Mattresses were too soft for us 2. Breakfast could be better

We stayed at this BW for the first night of our 4 night, 3 day vacation to Disneyland. It was a real shame we couldn't stay at this hotel longer. We spend the last 3 nights at the BW Anaheim Inn right across from they Disneyland entrance. This BW stood out in stark contrast from the other one we stayed out. It features clean rooms, friendly staff, and a newly remodeled lobby. It is quite obvious that the grounds are cared for. Rooms are good size (unlike Anaheim Inn), modern (unlike Anaheim Inn, who doesn't have flat screens like Placentia Inn does). Overall the only bad thing I can say is that I wish there were some sort of shuttle service to Disneyland. It would have been much better to stay here than the Anaheim Inn.

Summary Heading: Best Stay I've Had In Years
Summary: I'm on the road a good part of the year visiting construction sites and meeting with clients.  Many times I'm not sure where I'll wind up when the day comes to an end so I don't have advanced reservations.  All to often where I stay does not remain on my list of a place I wish to stay again.   Last week I saw a Best Western sign from the 57 freeway and pulled into the parking lot around 7pm.  There was a sign offering a "Walk In" special.  I walked in.  The lobby was not only decorated for Christmas, it was perfectly decorated.  The smell was clean, fresh, and nothing was out of place.  Miguel the desk clerk, gave me a big hello, a smile, and a great rate.  The room was a 10+.  It was like moving into a new home with everything you ever wanted in a place to live.  In the morning

Our room was very nice.  The carpeting needs to be cleaned more often, our white socks were black after just a few hours of lounging in our room.  Our first two nights were good, the third night was questionable.  There were children running up and down the hallways making alot of noise, although it was about 7:00 - 9:00 pm, it was still annoying.  The staff were all very nice and professional.  The breakfast was not hot, the eggs were cold as was the gravy and biscuits.  All-in-all, yes we would stay there again.  We were very pleased with the cleaniness and fresh smell of this Inn.  Perhaps a thing to keep in mind is to put families with children on a different floor or at the end of any floor away from couples.

Everything in the hotel was great! the front desk clerk i believe his name is Isaac was fantastic he was very helpful, respectful, and helped us have a very good vacation! i think he should be a runner-up for a raise! the breakfast was great! good quality for what you pay i will defenetly stay at this hotel again no doubt in my mind. i would really recommend it!

They lost personal property and when we asked them to find it, the manager laughed about it. Bad service, bad customer service, lack of security, lack of quality, etc. Go to another place if you want to have a good trip.

The service upon arrival was great, and extremely friendly. The hotel was recently remodeled, but they went cheap and didn't put microwaves, or freezers in the rooms. Advertised as "microwaves available" but none were available. This is the only hotel I have stayed in during the last 5 years that did not have these amenities, especially a Best Western Plus. The breakfast was great, with friendly and attentive service. But they lock the room after breakfast, so you cannot enjoy the break area, tv's or use a microwave... if they made one available. This room should be open 24hrs. They rooms were clean, and the price was ok. I expected better for a BW+

Summary Heading: Friendly, helpful staff; clean, comfortable rooms; good hot breakfast
Summary: On Thursday night, October 20, 2011, our over-sized family stayed in three identical rooms, all next to each other. Each room had two queen size beds, plus refrigerators for our traveling food/snacks. The bathrooms felt spacious and it was all clean and comfortable. The front staff was friendly and helpful, letting us know that we could get a 10% discount at the next door Denny's--which we did.  Several of our children took advantage of the pool. The staff let us know that when the door to the pool area closes, it stays locked, so they offered an extra towel or two to hold it slightly open so no one would get locked outside.  Breakfast was well-attended all morning. The waffle maker was in constant use, typically with a line, so I was disappointed when the batter wasn't refilled

Apparently this was a busy weekend for the Anaheim area. Blizzcon at the convention center took over all the hotels in Anaheim.  We were heading to Disneyland and this was the closest hotel.  Wow, we did not make a mistake by booking a room here! Busy as she was the hostess was friendly and efficient checking us in! The room was clean and the air conditioner worked. The bathroom was clean.There was a Denny's on property where we ate dinner, it was good for a Denny's (I am not a Denny's fan). I felt comfortable and safe in the neighborhood.Breakfast room was clean and the woman kept all the food filled and tables clean. Breakfast was a good surprise, with good choices, waffles, scramble eggs, biscuits/gravy, corned beef hash on Saturday, sausage on Sunday, bagels. My only

First impression is very important. That was exactly what I got from this hotel and staffs. The reception area is clean and big so that I thought I was walking in to much more expensive hotel. Room is nice and clean. Queen size beds are clean and comfortable. Good size bathroom. Located in quiet area. Feel almost like home. Free wifi. Staffs are friendly and professional. I was so happy that I stayed here twice. Booked through Costco travel. Saved money and times. Highly recommended!

I booked online the same day I stayed (10/4/2011).  Checked in late after 7:00pm.  It took less than 5 minutes to check in.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Did not have time to have breakfast but went to check it out: egg, sausage, orange juice, coffee ... Look good and clean. My friend stayed in other hotel nearby but said that my room was much bigger and cleaner.  Parking lot is huge. The room was clean.  King-size bed was firm just the way I like. Great value.

We booked our room online and had planned to check in around 4pm. We were running really late and called the hotel to make sure our room was still available and the man I spoke to assured us it would be. When we arrived we were able to check in right away in a matter of minutes. Our room was clean and beautiful with extremely soft beds and flat screen tvs. We were told breakfast would be served till 10am and when we arrived at 9:30 it was still being served and wasn't picked over lol. Overall a great experience!
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to review our Best Western PLUS Placentia Inn & Suites! I am so pleased to hear that you enjoyed our beds! All of our beds in the hotel are specialty beds, meaning you have your choice of a plush pillowtop mattress or a next generation memory foam bed! We hope to see you back again real soon!  Thank you,  Erin Lee  General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, Friendly staff - highly recommend!
Summary: Stayed here 3 nights on Aug 2-4. Hotel was very clean inside and out.. Room was large and both queen beds very comfortable. Front desk employees were very friendly and helpful with directions and advice. Waffle, egg, sausage, biscuits n gravy breakfast each morning was great too. Great value!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of our Best Western PLUS Placentia Inn & Suites! And we are so happy to hear that you liked our Deluxe Hot Breakfast! We really take pride in making sure that our breakfast is a filling and wholesome breakfast! We hope to see you again soon!   Thank you,  Erin Lee  General Manager

Summary Heading: Great value, very good quality, friendly, and convenient location.
Summary: We chose this hotel to be close to Disneyland, and it was a very quick trip from the hotel to the Disneyland parking lot.  Very good access to freeways, clean room, friendly staff.   You can hear the train whistle blow at night, but it didn't really bother us.  No parking fees, free high speed internet, big TV, and clean lobby area.  Will stay there again on next trip to California.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for your  kind review of our property. We always strive to make sure each and every guest has an enjoyable stay with us. We are looking forward to seeing you again soon!   Thank You,  Erin Coggins General Manager

Summary: This is an older hotel in an industrial area - not close to anything but the price was good.  The rooms are large BUT there was no microwave or refrigerator and we would have preferred them as we stayed here two nights.  The pool and spa were not sparkling clean the first day but much better the second day so we did spend some time in and around the pool.  The hotel reception staff are not very helpful and the included breakfast was only adequate.  If you are not able to get a cheaper room, this hotel would be adequate.  On the bright side, there is a Denny's on the property with extremely good food!  I would highly recommend the restaurant.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel on Tripadvisor. I am so sorry you did not have an enjoyable stay with us. Since you have stayed with us we have undergone some major changes. One of the most recent being the addition of mini-fridges in all of our rooms! We have also undergone some staffing changes and retraining. If you are ever in the area again we look forward to the chance to serve you again.   Thank you,  Erin Coggins General Manager

Summary: This hotel is the worst one we have ever stay in. NEVER COME IN THIS HOTEL!!! The service is horrible, the phone doesn't work, their air conditioning and coffee maker inconspicuously set off smoke, and they close down the pool for a whole day to "paint it." They also are pretty racist, we are mexican, the front desk clerk was black, we wanted a junior suite, and he said, "We're all out." An hour later, we came back from the denny's across the street, and there was a new front desk clerk. We asked again about the  suites, and she said that there were 2 available. Also, any room that isn't a suite doesn't have a fridge, microwave, or even a sofa, something that's standard in every other holiday inn express we've stayed at. (Title from Three's Company theme song; I'll get to that later) Stayed at many H.I. hotels and was always completely satisfied - until this one. I stayed in the jacuzzi suite and yes, I tried to use the jacuzzi (note the word 'tried'). When I ran the water, the cold water would not come on; turned the knob towards 'cold' and it remained hot. I wasn't in a hurry, so I let it cool down. Before I got in, I tested the jets. Yuck! Dirt, or whatever that stuff was, came out. I noticed it floating when I turned off the jets. I let the water out and settled for a shower.   The most frustrating part of my stay was on my departure day. Summary Heading: I was initially quite concern there weren't any recent reviews
Summary: Got a great rate at travelocity (hidden hotel) for $58 per night.  Excellent value.  Hotel is a solid 3 stars.  Need a car to stay there as nothing is near by.  About 20 min drive to Disneyland via hwy 57.  Very quiet hotel.  Don't think hotel was more than 50% full.  Good size, clean room (jr suite and reg room) and bathroom.  Standard, adequate breakfast included.  Free wireless internet plus 2 complimentary desktops with printer in lobby.  Lots of free parking.  Marriot Fairfield Inn and Marriot Suites are 2 blocks away right next to hwy 57.  From the outside, Holiday Inn Express Placentia looked like a better choice.  Would definitely stay again at the right price (i.e. less than $75 or $80).

This hotel is on a quiet street a couple blocks from the freeway.  Other than a Dennys right in front of the hotel, there aren't other businesses for a couple of blocks so it is a bit of an oasis.  The hotel itself is typical of others in the Holiday Inn Express chain - decent rooms with good beds (two queens).  A breakfast bar is included as it is in all Holiday Inn Express hotels, and it was the usual fare ... cereal, doughnuts, eggs etc. .... with the exception of no fresh fruit.  Our GPS led us to Disney through city streets, and it took 10-15 minutes.  One thing we really enjoyed was the Samurai restaurant about a mile away .... really good and reasonably inexpensive Japanese food (it doesn't seem to be listed in tripadvisor so I won't make a separate entry).  My take on

Summary Heading: Great Hotel/Price/Location But Beware For Your Credit Card Numbers
Summary: Absolutely zero complaints about the hotel itself - it was very clean, comfortable and convenient. Mysteriously, the credit card we paid with was used for 3 other unauthorized transactions the day we checked out. We had to cancel the card and proceed to convince our bank of the unauthorized charges. We know someone in this hotel used our card because it was my "emergency card" (rarely used). We are certain of this because my husband left his wallet in the taxi from the airport to the hotel (which was returned later that day), so I used our "emergency card" and did not use it again before canceling it once we discovered the unauthorized charges a few days after we returned home. We do not plan to do business with this hotel again since we have no idea which employee committed

Stayed here after a Transatlantic flight as a first night of a vacation.Perfect for a family as rooms are large and have all the amenities required.Room was on third floor and quiet which was great.Real plus was the swimming Pool which was large and clean and recieved sunlight until late.Complimentary Breakfast was excellent. If you are a fan of fast food Jack in the Box is just down the road and a Denny's is virtually adjoining the Hotel.

This hotel is easy to find off the highway and apparently convenient if you're visiting Disney.  I was in town for a business meeting, so its purpose for me was strictly sleep.  It was a good, clean room with a clean bathroom and fast WiFi connection.  The hotel was really quiet and it was easy to get a nice close parking spot (probably because I stayed on a Monday night).  I had to leave early in the morning so I wasn't able to take advantage of the free breakfast, but if you frequent HIE's you kind of know what to expect - the awesome cinnamon rolls and other goodies that get you started on the right foot.  For the location and price, you can't go wrong.    PS - if you're a Denny's fan, there's one a stone's throw away from the hotel.

This was our second time in the HIE Placentia. Our first stay was in June 2007 and we spent nearly a week in the hotel and fully enjoyed it.  Our second stay was only for 3 nights. I can only say I really missed the comfortable huge bed. The pillow collection as in all HIE is the best and for every taste catered. As we are roller coaster fans we usually spent our days walking miles in the different parks and therefore coming back to the room and having a bath in the great jacuzzi is just the best, it relaxes your muscles and you are fit for the next day without any pains.   This time when we stayed the big fires were just on and the area was a little dusty and smelly and we had a big group of workers in the hotel who did some work in the areas of the fire and it got a bit

My wife and I checked in after noon on a Friday for 4 nights during late April because the room rate was less than the luxury hotels and the location was within 3 miles of my sister's house.  Our first impression was "no hustle bustle, very quiet, but where was the desk clerk"?  After a couple of minutes a clerk appeared from a back room, but we noticed during our stay that the counter was often unmanned when we passed in coming and going.  Our 2nd floor room was accessible by elevator or circular stairway so we chose the carpeted stairway and noticed how dirty it was with small pieces of paper at top, center and bottom, not very encouraging.  For 24 hours it remained that way until some of the dirty bits were removed, and some remained.  Our room was standard size with no

Summary Heading: Nice but a bit of a drive to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed a few days in early March. Hotel sits in kind of an odd area. But it was nice and quiet there. Rooms were decent, bed was comfortable, bathroom was in good shape and appeared to be well cleaned. Only item that was any trouble was the a/c, it was hard to control it was either to cold or to warm in there. Did not get a chance to use the pool area. And the breakfast each morning was nice, we really enjoyed the hot sweet rolls each morning. It was about a 10 min drive to Disneyland so not to bad. Overall if don't mind the drive back and forth to DL it is not a bad place to stay.

This hotel is conveniently located right off the expressway.  Easy access to Orange Co, Fullerton, Anaheim, beaches and LA.  Staff day and night was superb and the housekeeping was very nice and considerate to the guests.  Breakfast at the hotel was moderate but fresh if you get their early, if not there is a Denny's right next door with excellent service.  If you have time go to Long Beach and visit the Queen Mary.  Of course head up to LA and visit all the star walks, Rodeo drive, and the famous Hollywood sign.  Be warned if the day starts of foggie and by 10 it still hasn't broken through don't waste your time going to see the famous Hollywood sign because you won't be able to see it from far distances and even close up.  If you love Sunday Brunches go to Orange Hill

Summary Heading: Everything we needed at a great price
Summary: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on a weekend trip to Disneyland the night of October 12-13, 2008.  Although it is a little further from Disneyland than other hotels, we were not disappointed with our selection.  The location is just fine, about a 5-10 minute drive to Disneyland and right next to Highway 57.  We got a one-bedroom suite that was comfortable with a bedroom and separate living room.  The accomodations were clean and quiet, the bed was comfortable, and there was ample work space in the living room (although we didn't work).  There is free breakfast in the morning that is tasty and filling (eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, cereal, coffee, and some of the best cinnamon rolls I've ever had) as well as a small gym with an elyptical machine (you cannot imagine how much

This was just the perfect place to stay:  close enough to Disneyland that you can leave the park in the afternoon and come back for a cool off at the pool, then go back to the park in the evening;  great price, and fantastic bed.  Super clean, and comfortable room.  The hot tub by the pool was a great way to end the day.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Second time here - still a great deal!
Summary: We just returned from our second stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Placentia and it was even better than the last visit.  The beds are so comfortable that we will be contacting the property directly to find out who makes them.  They are putting in a new breakfast room that will include hot food so that should be nice, but the current breakfast is just fine.  The parking lot is well-lit and we didn't have a problem with parking even after arriving back from Disneyland well after midnight.  The property is totally non-smoking which is a big plus to me and my family.  It takes about 15-20 minutes to get to Disneyland.  The only downside was that there wasn't any mini-fridge or microwave in the room.  We will stay here again if we come back into the area.

We stayed in the Holiday Inn Express on a recent trip to Disneyland. It was fairyly close to the park (15 min. drive) and we were plesantly surprised to find this was a totally non-smoking hotel. The rooms were large with 2 queen beds and a couch/sitting area. We enjoyed the beds/bedding and our room was very clean. The desk staff were effecient and helpful. The hot tub was not working while we were there which was a disappointment after long days at the theme parks, and they are working on their new hot breakfast room, which was not quite finished when we checked out on 3/23/08. All-in-all we would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to So. California.

Stayed at this hotel recently with my family and was completly surprised! I booked an advance purchase rate and while I realised at the time of booking that I was not able to cancel it the rate was tooo great to pass up!   Check in was smooth and easy and I was actually upgraded becasue they had sold out!! It was a great perk! Their breakfast room was a bit under done however I did peek through the glass doors of the new room! And I am sooooo coming back!   As far as I am concerned this hotel offers you a great amount of value!

Just got back from a 7 night stay at this hotel.  Check-in and out was very easy.  The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly.  In fact, about 15 minutes after we checked in, the front desk called to be sure everything was satisfactory for us.  The only critical comment was that it seemed that only 1 person at a time was on duty at the front desk so sometimes you had to wait for that person to return to the desk or wait in line.  I had a relative try to reach me via phone a few times and she ended up calling me on my cell phone because nobody answered the hotel phone.  They had the "standard" continential breakfast items (their famous warm cinamon buns, cold boiled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, instant oatmeal, cold cereal, juice, coffee) but were working on their newer hot
Good value location rooms are  good, Not to far to Disney lotsa shopping nearby

We just got back from a stay last week when we were in town visiting family. This was our second stay at this hotel and we came back because of the comfortable bed. The room itself is OK, nothing special but is maintained well. The only complaint is that all the rooms have a musty smell to them. But the air worked well, mini fridge cooled really well,  & free high speed internet in the room with good signal strength. I've never had such a great nights sleep in any hotel as I've had when staying here because the bed is really comfortable-would recommend for this reason alone!

Summary Heading: Not bad - wouldn't recommend for vacation, but ok for business...
Summary: I stayed in this hotel from May 6th through the 10th with my family.  We were told that the room was big enough for all of us (family of four), but we were VERY cramped!!!  The room was average with a dresser, desk with two chairs, two queen sized beds, closet, television, and bathroom... nothing extra and nothing short.  Not much else to say but that this was extremely average...  If you are used to staying at Holiday Inn Express hotels, the breakfast was average as well - nothing out of the ordinary.    Word of caution, though.  If you are attracted to this hotel because of its title, "Holiday Inn Express Placentia - Disneyland Park Area," don't be fooled.  Yes, this is within five miles of Disneyland, but it is extremely far in Los Angeles traffic - especially if you go

We stayed there from March 25-April 2,2007. Check in and check out was a breeze. Cleaned our room daily. Didn't get the tip that we left in the room! The free breakfast was ok. But there's a Denny's right across if you want heavy breakfast. Very convenient place to stay in. Went to Disney for 2 days(just a short drive from this hotel about 6 miles). Bed was great! Only negative here was there's no refrigerator(needed it for storage of my kid's milk). Parking was good. Shower was great. Overall, we had an awesome stay. Will gladly stay here again next time!   P.S. The kind manager of Denny's (i think) gave my daughter a stuffed toy when we didn't get one from the toy machine! Haha!

We only stayed at this property for 1 night passing through LA.  The location was great 2 blocks off the major highway. Staff was very friendly upon checkin. Upon getting to our oversized room, it was in excellent condition with the new "Simply Smart" bedding. We didn't want to leave the next morning after sleeping in the new beds. There was also free internet service at this hotel.  The hotel was very quiet, but did not have much of a view.  There is a Denny's at the front of the propety so you can grab a bite to eat anytime you want. We would stay at this property again if we were in the area.

We had a GREAT stay at this hotel!  It is easy to get to...right off the freeway.  The price was very reasonable for the area.  The front desk staff was extremely courteous, respectful, helpful, and professional.  I love the new bedding...soft, cozy, & comfortable.  The bed was great...supportive without being hard.  The rooms were a decent size and the free wireless internet was great.  We also love the breakfast...traditional Holiday Inn Express breakfast with yummy cinnamon rolls, etc.  There is also a Denny's practically attached to the hotel, so you can easily get a full breakfast if you'd like.  Our room seemed very quiet...we didn't hear any noise from outside the hotel or from the hallway or other rooms except in the morning when we heard a shower come on in another

Stayed here with my husband and daughter for 5 nights and it was great.  The staff is friendly, the rooms are a good size and clean.  The beds are so comfortable you wish you could stay longer.  We will definitely stay here again!

The review written on Aug 9, 2006 by kysf has been confirmed by myself! Everything that is written describes the hotel exactly and my hotel stay. My boyfriend and I decided to stay here for a short weekend getaway, we got a suite with a jacuzzi. We've stayed at holiday inn express before and so we were not surprised when it was exactly like the others, fantastic!   Our room was clean, well supplied and the jacuzzi was exactly as shown in their pictures. The bed was so comfortable that we would've slept in and skipped our breakfast but decided to take advantage of it. The breakfast was great, the food was fresh, and they actually keep it well stocked (which suited us well because when we stayed, there were hundreds of university students staying over also, who we though would

We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at this hotel.  We weren't expecting much because of its rating, just a clean, simple place to stay at.  I don't know if all of the Holiday Inn Express hotels were a part of this, but it looked like they revamped their image and attempted to be more like a Westin in terms of presentation, without the Westin price tag.  It was great!  The bedding not only looked great, but was nice to sleep in.  They gave us each two pillows - a firm and a soft one for each person to choose from.  (The pillows were labeled too!)  How cool is that?  Oh, and a couple of mints on the bed each morning to sweeten it.  :)  The bath towels were thick and nice.  The toiletries were displayed nicely as well.  A make-up remover cloth was also included!  What a

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is very nicely kept. This place had free internet, free breakfast, which was really great. The staff was friendly and always with smiles. We would not hesitate to come here again.

I got a room for nine continuous days through Priceline over President's day weekend.  Paid more than I wanted, Especially since Priceline decided this was a 2 1/2 star, while EVERYONE ELSE gave it two stars only.  Regardless, it was a VERY nice room, with free internet access and complimentary continental breakfast.  When you are with a 12 year old at Disneyland, that alone pays for the room.

Won this hotel on Hotwire for a great price.  Was pleasantly surprised by:  very nice, soft beds; very good Continental breakfast including bagels, cream cheese, boiled eggs, yogurt, coffee was good; two computers in the lobby that we could use with free high-speed internet.  We weren't as close to Disneyland as we would have liked, but it only took maybe 15 minutes to get to the park.  One night we grabbed a hotdog at Costco, that balanced out the pricey lunch we had earlier that day.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Only downside was the tv reception on local channels wasn't good -- the friend I went with couldn't miss the CMA's.

We were visiting family living in Anaheim and we stayed at this Holiday Inn Express in Placentia and enjoyed our four night stay very much.  It was quiet, clean, and had all amenities.  The continental breakfast was all that a continental breakfast should be with a wonderful breakfast room overlooking the pool.  Staff was very helpful and courteous.  Front Lobby door is locked after a certain hour and you need your room card key to get in, which we felt added to the security of the hotel guests after dark.  Surrounding area was a quiet neighborhood.  Disneyland and other attractions were within 10 miles.

I was disappointed in this hotel at first.  The 3rd room they gave us finally worked.  First we had a room with a strange odor - they said they had just gone to a non-smoking hotel, but our room was not pleasant!  The second room had a problem with the bed - it was on a platform and if you sat on the edge, the other side of the bed picked up.  The 3rd room worked for us, but I had to ask them to come a replace the light bulb in the entry hallway.   The hotel was clean, good location, decent breakfast, and quiet.

Summary Heading: Disneyland Weekend at the Holiday Inn Express
Summary: My family stayed at the Holiday Inn Express over Labor Day Weekend, 2003. We had booked the room through Priceline, so we weren't exactly sure what we would end up with. What a wonderful surprise! Nice clean, spacious room. Friendly, helpful staff. Great breakfast. Plenty of parking. Nice pool and spa but two nearby trees were loosing their leaves. However, they ran out of ice (two machines for the entire hotel obviously aren't enough). Not close to Disneyland, but there is easy freeway access. It took us about 7 min. to get to the park. The ice situation kept them from getting an excellent rating from me, but I would definitely stay there again.  David from Mesa, AZ
